{"body":"<p>I am creating a form in Rails.</p>\n<p>Is it possible to make an input text that works similar to a Select2?</p>\n<p>Example: a word that is written in the field can know if it already exists in the DB, using the select2 and that when you say something new in that same field, a record is created with the new word that was written.</p>\n<p>I have the following:</p>\n<pre><code>  &lt;%= f.label 'New title' %&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\n  &lt;%= text_field_tag :newtittle %&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>Controller:</p>\n<pre><code>class HvEducationsController &lt; ApplicationController\n  layout 'main'\n\n  def update_title\n\n    if params[:id]\n      specialities = HvEducation.find(params[:id])\n    else\n      if params[:hv_education_level_id] == '1' or params[:hv_education_level_id] == '2' or params[:hv_education_level_id] == '3'\n        specialities = HvEducationTitle.order(&quot;name&quot;)\n      else\n        specialities = 0\n      end\n    end\n\n\n\n    # Actualiza las especialidades basadas en la categoria tecnica seleccionada\n    #       specialities = HvEducationLevel.find(params[:])\n    #\n    #       unless specialities.id &gt;= 4 and specialities.id &lt;= 7\n    #         specialities =  HvEducationTitle.all\n    #         specialities.sort! { |a,b| a.name.downcase &lt;=&gt; b.name.downcase }\n    #       end\n\n    render :update do |page|\n      page.replace_html 'specialities', :partial =&gt; 'specialities', :object =&gt; specialities\n    end\n\n  end\n\n  # GET /hv_educations\n  # GET /hv_educations.xml\n  def index\n    @hv_educations = HvEducation.all\n\n    respond_to do |format|\n      format.html # index.html.erb\n      format.xml  { render :xml =&gt; @hv_educations }\n    end\n  end\n\n  # GET /hv_educations/1\n  # GET /hv_educations/1.xml\n  def show\n    @hv_education = HvEducation.find(params[:id])\n\n    respond_to do |format|\n      format.html # show.html.erb\n      format.xml  { render :xml =&gt; @hv_education }\n    end\n  end\n\n  # GET /hv_educations/new\n  # GET /hv_educations/new.xml\n  def new\n    @hv_education = HvEducation.new\n\n    respond_to do |format|\n      format.html # new.html.erb\n      format.xml  { render :xml =&gt; @hv_education }\n    end\n  end\n\n  # GET /hv_educations/1/edit\n  def edit\n    @hv_education = HvEducation.find(params[:id])\n    @upd_title = @hv_education.hv_education_title.name\n    puts &quot;asdasd #{@upd_title}&quot;\n  end\n\n  # POST /hv_educations\n  # POST /hv_educations.xml\n  def create\n    @hv_education = HvEducation.new(params[:hv_education])\n\n\n\n    unless params[:newtittle].blank?\n\n      @new_title = HvEducationTitle.new\n      @new_title.name = params[:newtittle]\n      @titles = HvEducationTitle.where('id&gt;?', 0)\n      @titles.each do |ubi|\n        if ubi.name == @new_title.name\n          flash[:notice] = 'Ya existe un titulo con ese mismo nombre.'\n          return redirect_to(:action =&gt; 'new')\n        else\n          @new_title.save\n          @new_title.id\n          @hv_education.hv_education_title_id = @new_title.id\n          puts &quot;NUEVO TITULO&quot;, params[:newtittle]\n        end\n      end\n\n\n\n    end\n\n\n\n    respond_to do |format|\n      if @hv_education.save\n        @hv_education.hv_user.umdate if @hv_education.hv_user\n        redirect_to  hv_user_show_path(HvUser.where(&quot;user_id =?&quot;, session[:user_id_by_hv]).first.id, user_slug: session[:user_slug]) + &quot;#page=page-4&quot;#'/hv_users/hvtab#page=page-4'\n        return\n\n        #flash[:notice] = 'HvEducation was successfully created.'\n        #format.html { redirect_to(@hv_education) }\n        #format.xml  { render :xml =&gt; @hv_education, :status =&gt; :created, :location =&gt; @hv_education }\n      else\n        format.html { render :action =&gt; &quot;new&quot; }\n        format.xml  { render :xml =&gt; @hv_education.errors, :status =&gt; :unprocessable_entity }\n      end\n    end\n  end\n\n  # PUT /hv_educations/1\n  # PUT /hv_educations/1.xml\n  def update\n    @hv_education = HvEducation.find(params[:id])\n    @hv_education.hv_education_title_id\n    @udp = HvEducationTitle.find(@hv_education.hv_education_title_id)\n    @udp.update_attribute(:name, params[:newtittle])\n\n=begin\n    @titles = HvEducationTitle.where('id&gt;?', 0)\n    @titles.each do |ubi|\n      if ubi.name == params[:newtittle]\n        flash[:notice] = 'Ya existe un titulo con ese mismo nombre.'\n        return redirect_to(:action =&gt; 'edit')\n      else\n        @udp.update_attribute(:name, params[:newtittle])\n      end\n    end\n=end\n\n\n\n    respond_to do |format|\n      if @hv_education.update_attributes(params[:hv_education])\n        @hv_education.hv_user.umdate if @hv_education.hv_user\n        redirect_to  hv_user_show_path(HvUser.where(&quot;user_id =?&quot;, session[:user_id_by_hv]).first.id, user_slug: session[:user_slug]) + &quot;#page=page-4&quot;#'/hv_users/hvtab#page=page-4'\n        return\n        #flash[:notice] = 'HvEducation was successfully updated.'\n        #format.html { redirect_to(@hv_education) }\n        #format.xml  { head :ok }\n      else\n        format.html { render :action =&gt; &quot;edit&quot; }\n        format.xml  { render :xml =&gt; @hv_education.errors, :status =&gt; :unprocessable_entity }\n      end\n    end\n  end\n\n  # DELETE /hv_educations/1\n  # DELETE /hv_educations/1.xml\n  def destroy\n    @hv_education = HvEducation.find(params[:id])\n    @hv_education.destroy\n\n    redirect_to  hv_user_show_path(HvUser.where(&quot;user_id =?&quot;, session[:user_id_by_hv]).first.id, user_slug: session[:user_slug]) + &quot;#page=page-4&quot;#'/hv_users/hvtab#page=page-4'\n    return\n\n    #respond_to do |format|\n    #  format.html { redirect_to(hv_educations_url) }\n    #  format.xml  { head :ok }\n    #end\n  end\nend\n</code></pre>\n<p>(The text_field_tag ​​is because I am combining 2 forms.)</p>\n<p>The field already creates a new title and validates that it is not repeated (<strong>with validates_uniqueness_of</strong>)</p>\n<p>what I would like to make more dynamic is that when someone is going to create a new title in the field, the same field should look for what is already in the database from the table &quot;titles&quot;, if there is nothing similar, the new one title is created.</p>\n<p>The select2 works something similar and it shows me in real time what one finds with each letter that is written. but I've only done it with &quot;selects&quot;</p>\n<p>Thanks!</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":102,"question_id":65040729,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>i used ajax for crud in laravel. when update or add data, add new row to list but return string 'undefined' and when refresh this page show real text.<br>\n<strong>how to resolve this problem?</strong>\n<br><br></p>\n<p><strong>Controller:</strong></p>\n<pre><code>public function update(Request $request, $user_id)\n{\n        $user = User::where('id', $user_id)-&gt;update([\n            'name' =&gt; $request-&gt;input('name'),\n            'email' =&gt; $request-&gt;input('email'),\n            'password' =&gt; Hash::make($request-&gt;input('password')),\n        ]);\n\n        if ($request-&gt;input('role') == 'admin'){\n            $user = DB::table('model_has_roles')-&gt;where('model_id', $user_id)-&gt;update([\n                'role_id' =&gt; 2,\n                'model_type' =&gt; 'App\\User',\n                'model_id' =&gt; $user_id,\n            ]);\n        } else {\n            $user = DB::table('model_has_roles')-&gt;where('model_id', $user_id)-&gt;update([\n                'role_id' =&gt; 1,\n                'model_type' =&gt; 'App\\User',\n                'model_id' =&gt; $user_id,\n            ]);\n        }\n\n        return response()-&gt;json($user);\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>View:</strong></p>\n<pre><code>@foreach ($users as $user)\n    &lt;tr id=&quot;user{{$user-&gt;id}}&quot; class=&quot;active&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;td&gt;{{$user-&gt;name}}&lt;/td&gt;\n        &lt;td&gt;{{$user-&gt;email}}&lt;/td&gt;\n        &lt;td&gt;{{ $user-&gt;hasRole('admin') ? 'Admin' : 'Author' }}&lt;/td&gt;\n        &lt;td width=&quot;35%&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;button class=&quot;btn btn-warning btn-detail open_modal&quot; value=&quot;{{$user-&gt;id}}&quot;&gt; Edit &lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;button class=&quot;btn btn-danger btn-delete delete-user&quot; value=&quot;{{$user-&gt;id}}&quot;&gt; Delete &lt;/button&gt;\n        &lt;/td&gt;\n    &lt;/tr&gt;\n@endforeach\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>js codes for ajax</strong></p>\n<pre><code>$(document).ready(function(){\n\n\n    //get base URL *********************\n    var url = $('#url').val();\n\n\n    //display modal form for creating new user *********************\n    $('#btn_add').click(function(){\n        $('#btn-save').val(&quot;add&quot;);\n        $('#frmusers').trigger(&quot;reset&quot;);\n        $('#myModal').modal('show');\n    });\n\n\n\n    //display modal form for user EDIT ***************************\n    $(document).on('click','.open_modal',function(){\n        var user_id = $(this).val();\n\n        // Populate Data in Edit Modal Form\n        $.ajax({\n            type: &quot;GET&quot;,\n            url: url + '/' + user_id,\n            success: function (data) {\n                console.log(data);\n                $('#user_id').val(data.id);\n                $('#name').val(data.name);\n                $('#password').val(data.password);\n                $('#email').val(data.email);\n                $('#btn-save').val(&quot;update&quot;);\n                $('#myModal').modal('show');\n            },\n            error: function (data) {\n                console.log('Error:', data);\n            }\n        });\n    });\n\n\n\n    //create new user / update existing user ***************************\n    $(&quot;#btn-save&quot;).click(function (e) {\n        $.ajaxSetup({\n            headers: {\n                'X-CSRF-TOKEN': $('meta[name=&quot;csrf-token&quot;]').attr('content')\n            }\n        })\n\n        e.preventDefault();\n        var formData = {\n            name: $('#name').val(),\n            email: $('#email').val(),\n            password: $('#password').val(),\n            role: $('#role').val(),\n        }\n\n        //used to determine the http verb to use [add=POST], [update=PUT]\n        var state = $('#btn-save').val();\n        var type = &quot;POST&quot;; //for creating new resource\n        var user_id = $('#user_id').val();;\n        var my_url = url;\n        if (state == &quot;update&quot;){\n            type = &quot;PUT&quot;; //for updating existing resource\n            my_url += '/' + user_id;\n        }\n        console.log(formData);\n        $.ajax({\n            type: type,\n            url: my_url,\n            data: formData,\n            dataType: 'json',\n            success: function (data) {\n                console.log(data);\n                var user = '&lt;tr id=&quot;user' + data.id + '&quot;&gt;&lt;td&gt;' + data.name + '&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;' + data.email + '&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;' + data.role + '&lt;/td&gt;';\n                user += '&lt;td&gt;&lt;button class=&quot;btn btn-warning btn-detail open_modal&quot; value=&quot;' + data.id + '&quot;&gt;ویرایش&lt;/button&gt;';\n                user += ' &lt;button class=&quot;btn btn-danger btn-delete delete-user&quot; value=&quot;' + data.id + '&quot;&gt;حذف&lt;/button&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;';\n                if (state == &quot;add&quot;){ //if user added a new record\n                    $(&quot;#users-list&quot;).append(user);\n                }else{ //if user updated an existing record\n                    $(&quot;#user&quot; + user_id).replaceWith( user );\n                }\n                $('#frmusers').trigger(&quot;reset&quot;);\n                $('#myModal').modal('hide')\n            },\n            error: function (data) {\n                console.log('Error:', data);\n            }\n        });\n    });\n\n\n    //delete user and remove it from TABLE list ***************************\n    $(document).on('click','.delete-user',function(){\n        var user_id = $(this).val();\n        $.ajaxSetup({\n            headers: {\n                'X-CSRF-TOKEN': $('meta[name=&quot;csrf-token&quot;]').attr('content')\n            }\n        })\n        $.ajax({\n            type: &quot;DELETE&quot;,\n            url: url + '/' + user_id,\n            success: function (data) {\n                console.log(data);\n                $(&quot;#user&quot; + user_id).remove();\n            },\n            error: function (data) {\n                console.log('Error:', data);\n            }\n        });\n    });\n\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>................................................................................................................................................................................................</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":103,"question_id":65040722,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I am struggling with creating the overlay on my map. I want to incorporate the example like here:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://openlayers.org/en/latest/examples/overlay.html\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://openlayers.org/en/latest/examples/overlay.html</a></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/module-ol_Overlay-Overlay.html\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/module-ol_Overlay-Overlay.html</a></p>\n<p>but I cannot use the <code>import</code> statement, because I am getting an error:</p>\n<p><strong>Uncaught SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module</strong></p>\n<p>which has an explanation here:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node#syntaxerror\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-node#syntaxerror</a></p>\n<p>and here:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51093964/why-examples-dont-work-a-struggle-with-imports\">Why examples don&#39;t work? (a struggle with imports)</a></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58211880/uncaught-syntaxerror-cannot-use-import-statement-outside-a-module-when-import\">&quot;Uncaught SyntaxError: Cannot use import statement outside a module&quot; when importing ECMAScript 6</a></p>\n<p>I tried to do sth like this:</p>\n<pre><code>      &lt;script type=&quot;module&quot; chrome-extension, chrome-untrusted, https.</strong></p>\n<p>Unfortunately I need this feature offline.</p>\n<p>In this thread I found, that there is an alternative to the import feature:</p>\n<p><a ol.Overlay({\n   element: container,\n   autoPan: true,\n   autoPanAnimation: {\n   duration: 250,\n   },\n  });\n\n   var popup = new overlay({\n   element: document.getElementById('popup'),\n  });\n   map.addOverlay(popup);\n\n  // Vienna marker\n  var marker = new overlay({\n  position: pos,\n  positioning: 'center-center',\n  element: document.getElementById('marker'),\n  stopEvent: false,\n  });\n  map.addOverlay(marker);\n\n // Vienna label\n var vienna = new overlay({\n position: pos,\n element: document.getElementById('vienna'),\n });\n map.addOverlay(vienna);\n\n map.on('click', function (evt) {\n var element = popup.getElement();\n var coordinate = evt.coordinate;\n var hdms = toStringHDMS(toLonLat(coordinate));\n\n  $(element).popover('dispose');\n  popup.setPosition(coordinate);\n  $(element).popover({\n  container: element,\n  placement: 'top',\n  animation: false,\n  html: true,\n  content: '&lt;p&gt;The location you clicked was:&lt;/p&gt;&lt;code&gt;' + hdms + '&lt;/code&gt;',\n  });\n  $(element).popover('show');\n   });\n</code></pre>\n<p>and now I am getting an error like this:</p>\n<p><strong>Uncaught TypeError: {"body":"<p>I am using below query</p>\n<pre><code> // get all events\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    const currentDate = new Date();\n\n    const listEvents = () =&gt; {\n      try {\n        return (\n          firestore()\n            .collection('events')\n            .where('status', '==', 'Active')\n            .where('propertyId', 'in', [user.propertyId, 'All'])\n            .where('eventFromDateTime', '&gt;=', currentDate)\n            // .orderBy('eventFromDateTime', 'desc')\n            .onSnapshot((querySnapshot) =&gt; {\n              const _events = [];\n\n              if (querySnapshot) {\n                querySnapshot.forEach((documentSnapshot) =&gt; {\n                  const event = documentSnapshot.data();\n                  const fromEventDateTime = event.eventFromDateTime\n                    ? moment(event.eventFromDateTime.toMillis())\n                    : null;\n                  const toEventDateTime = event.eventToDateTime\n                    ? moment(event.eventToDateTime.toMillis())\n                    : null;\n                  const eventDate = fromEventDateTime.format('YYYY-MM-DD');\n\n                  const eventFromDateTime = fromEventDateTime.format(\n                    timeFormat,\n                  );\n                  const eventToDateTime = toEventDateTime.format(timeFormat);\n\n                  _events.push({\n                    ...documentSnapshot.data(),\n                    category: event.category || null,\n                    eventDate: eventDate,\n                    title: event.title,\n                    description: event.description,\n                    status: event.status,\n                    eventFromDateTime: eventFromDateTime,\n                    eventToDateTime: eventToDateTime,\n                    totalRegister: event.totalRegister || null,\n                    totalWaiting: event.totalWaiting || null,\n                    updatedAt: documentSnapshot.data().updatedAt.toMillis(),\n                  });\n                });\n              }\n\n              setEvents(_events);\n              setIsLoading(false);\n            })\n        );\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.log(error);\n        setError(error.message);\n      }\n    };\n\n    if (user &amp;&amp; user.propertyId) {\n      return listEvents();\n    }\n  }, [user]);\n</code></pre>\n<p>There is no error returning in the <code>console.log</code></p>\n<p><em>I just noticed, it return 2 documents first and then looks like it called second time and returned no documents.</em></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/rhqcZ.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/rhqcZ.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>If I comment <code>.where('eventFromDateTime', '&gt;=', currentDate)</code> then only it returns document.</p>\n<p>This is how data looks like in my databse:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/NQNUJ.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/NQNUJ.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a>\nCould you tell me what is wrong with this query please?</p>\n<p>Thanks</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":107,"question_id":65040698,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>this is my code to create the javascript typing speed game. How do i capture the wpm and accuracy once a user registered user plays the game in my site. I want to save them so i can later give them statistics. I have an sql database named speed and accuracy but i have to collect those from the game as the user plays. wpm is the words typed per minute and the accuracy is the number of correct words per typed number of words. All the calculations are done by the javascript functions.</p>\n<pre><code>let accuracy_text = document.querySelector(&quot;.init_accuracy&quot;);\nlet error_text = document.querySelector(&quot;.init_errors&quot;);\nlet words_text = document.querySelector(&quot;.init_wpm&quot;);\nlet content_text = document.querySelector(&quot;.content&quot;);\nlet input_box = document.querySelector(&quot;.input_box&quot;);\nlet start_btn = document.querySelector(&quot;.start&quot;);\nlet restart_btn = document.querySelector(&quot;.restart&quot;);\nlet wpm_group = document.querySelector(&quot;.wpm&quot;);\nlet error_group = document.querySelector(&quot;.errors&quot;);\nlet accuracy_group = document.querySelector(&quot;.accuracy&quot;);\n\nlet time_left = 60;\nlet time_passed = 0;\nlet total_errors = 0;\nlet errors = 0;\nlet accuracy = 0;\nlet typed = 0;\nlet current_content = &quot;&quot;;\nlet c = 0;\nlet timer = null;\n\n\nfunction ChangeContent() {\n  content_text.textContent = null;\n  current_content =&quot;The four seasons are spring, summer, fall, and winter, and although various areas of the United States experience drastically different weather during these times, all portions of the country recognize the seasons; winter in California may bring heat, and winter in New York may bring blizzards, but both periods are nevertheless winter.&quot;\n  \n  current_content.split('').forEach(char =&gt; {\n    const charSpan = document.createElement('span');\n    charSpan.innerText = char;\n    content_text.appendChild(charSpan);\n  })\n\n}\n\nfunction textInput() {\n  input = input_box.value;\n  input_array = input.split('');\n  typed++;\n  errors = 0;\n  quoteSpanArray = content_text.querySelectorAll('span');\n  quoteSpanArray.forEach((char, index) =&gt; {\n  let typed = input_array[index]\n  if (typed == null) {\n      char.classList.remove('correct');\n  } \n  else if (typed === char.innerText) {\n      char.classList.add('correct');\n  } \n  else {\n    errors++;\n  }\n});\n\n  error_text.textContent = total_errors + errors;\n  let correctCharacters = (typed - (total_errors + errors));\n  let accuracyData = ((correctCharacters / typed) * 100);\n  accuracy_text.textContent = Math.round(accuracyData);\n\n  if (input.length == current_content.length) {\n    ChangeContent();\n    total_errors += errors;\n    input_box.value = &quot;&quot;;\n  }\n}\n\n\nfunction updateTimer() {\n  if (time_left &gt; 0) {\n    time_left--;\n    time_passed++;\n    timer_text.textContent = time_left ;\n  }\n  else {\n    finishGame();\n  }\n}\n\nfunction finishGame() {\n  clearInterval(timer)\n  input_box.disabled = true;\n  content_text.style.display=&quot;none&quot;;\n  wpm = Math.round((((typed / 5) / time_passed) * 60));\n  words_text.textContent = wpm;\n  wpm_group.style.display = &quot;block&quot;;\n}\n\n\nfunction startGame() {\n  content_text.style.display=&quot;block&quot;;\n  resetGame();\n  ChangeContent();\n  clearInterval(timer);\n  timer = setInterval(updateTimer, 1000);\n}\n\nfunction resetGame() {\n  time_left = 60;\n  time_passed = 0;\n  errors = 0;\n  total_errors = 0;\n  accuracy = 0;\n  typed = 0;\n  c = 0;\n  input_box.disabled = false;\n  input_box.value = &quot;&quot;;\n  content_text.textContent = &quot;&quot;;\n  accuracy_text.textContent = 100;\n  timer_text.textContent = time_left;\n  error_text.textContent = 0;\n  restart_btn.style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n  wpm_group.style.display = &quot;none&quot;;\n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":109,"question_id":65040662,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Basically, I am trying to show an animation fill mode that has effects. I have the animation that I want, but for some reason, it is not responsive. lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>* {\n    margin: 0;\n    padding: 0;\n}\nbody {\n    overflow: hidden;\n}\n.box {\n    width: 100px;\n    height: 100px;\n    margin: 10px;\n    display: flex;\n    justify-content: center;\n    align-items: center;\n    background-color: #f6f6f6;\n}\n.animate {\n    animation-name: move;\n    animation-duration: 3s;\n    animation-timing-function: ease;\n    animation-delay: 1s;\n}\n.none {\n    animation-fill-mode: none;\n}\n.forwards {\n    animation-fill-mode: forwards;\n}\n.backwards {\n    animation-fill-mode: backwards;\n}\n.both {\n    animation-fill-mode: both;\n}\n@keyframes move {\n    from {\n        transform: translateX(0);\n    }\n    to {\n        transform: translateX(1320px);\n        background-color: lightpink;\n {"body":"<p>The below script works well but I am looking to add the ability to refresh the index.htm page as part of the script and not the meta refresh tag. My &quot;open&quot; hours are Monday to Friday, 8am to 5pm.</p>\n<p>It refreshes every 1 minute after page load but I want it to refresh every minute only during the &quot;open&quot; hours and not outside of it. However, if a visitor opens the index.htm page on a Monday at 7:59 am, is there should be a way to force page reload once it is 8:00 am. Would appreciate your help.</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;meta http-equiv=&quot;refresh&quot; content=&quot;60;url=index.htm&quot;&gt;\n=======\n&lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;\nvar view = [\n    'open-menu.png', \n    'closed-menu.png'\n]; \nonload = function () {\n  var now = new Date();\n  var dayofweek = now.getDay();\n  var HH = now.getHours();\n  if ( ((HH &gt;= 8) &amp;&amp; (HH &lt; 17)) &amp;&amp; ((dayofweek &gt;= 1) &amp;&amp; (dayofweek &lt;= 5)) ) {\n    document.getElementById('image').src = view[0];\n  } else {\n    document.getElementById('image').src = view[1];\n  }\n}\n&lt;/script&gt;\n========\n&lt;body&gt;\n&lt;img id=&quot;image&quot; src=&quot;&quot;&gt;\n&lt;/body&gt;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":111,"question_id":65040622,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I was wondering how would I be able to send the message entered from the form box above, to a specific email address, while using the users entered email as the sending address? Is this possible to accomplish through html or would I have to use some sort of JavaScript to accomplish this? Anything helps and thanks in advance!</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script&gt;\nconst inputs = document.querySelectorAll(\".input\");\n\nfunction focusFunc() {\n  let parent = this.parentNode;\n  parent.classList.add(\"focus\");\n}\n\nfunction blurFunc() {\n  let parent = this.parentNode;\n  if (this.value == \"\") {\n    parent.classList.remove(\"focus\");\n  }\n}\n\ninputs.forEach((input) =&gt; {\n  input.addEventListener(\"focus\", focusFunc);\n  input.addEventListener(\"blur\", blurFunc);\n});\n&lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;style&gt;\n@import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Raleway:wght@200;300;400;500;600;700&amp;display=swap');\n@font-face { font-family: Raleway; src: }\n}\n&lt;/style&gt;</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html lang=\"en\"&gt;\n  &lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta {"body":"<p>AM willing to control devices connected to NodeMCU via mobile. So here Node will act as some server, hosting devices as services.</p>\n<p>Am not willing to place a long HTML code in Arduino Cpp code &amp; compile it; Rather, all the web-pages will be present in a general purpose device such as PC, smartphone. These mobile devices would get connected to Node's access point (wifi network). Once device is connected to Node's network, it'd open those locally saved HTML code/s.</p>\n<p>Clicking on a button in the web-page would POST a code to NodeMCU. Depending on received number, NodeMCU will take action <code>on</code> corresponding hardware.</p>\n<p>I've seen many examples which toggle LEDs. But they require function handler for each button press., and this method makes Arduino-Cpp code a lot longer.</p>\n<p>Please help me with proper library functions or built-in methods to use on both sides. I've seen overloaded <a href=\"https://github.com/esp8266/Arduino/blob/4aeb0f5cca337cfc174b52c0eaf9c84b7dda64bb/libraries/ESP8266WebServer/src/ESP8266WebServer.h#L117\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><code>on</code></a> method in <a href=\"https://github.com/esp8266/Arduino/blob/4aeb0f5cca337cfc174b52c0eaf9c84b7dda64bb/libraries/ESP8266WebServer/src/ESP8266WebServer.h#L117\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">ESP8266WebServer.h</a> file. But am unable to find an example which briefs what each function does. And how can mobile POST a code (number) without waiting for response &amp; without reloading the page.</p>\n<p>I also referred <a href=\"https://lastminuteengineers.com/creating-esp8266-web-server-arduino-ide/amp/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">this</a> link as a beginner guide.\nOne more <a href=\"https://arduino-esp8266.readthedocs.io/en/latest/esp8266wifi/readme.html\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">reference</a>.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":112,"question_id":65040608,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>This is my program:</p>\n<pre><code>let existingData = {\n    name: 'David',\n    age: 32,\n    isSingle: true,\n    country: 'United States'\n};\n\nlet input = {\n    name: 'Mike',\n    age: null, // The question is how to keep age value to be 32\n    isSingle: false,\n    country: 'France'\n};\n\nexistingData['name'] = input['name'];\nexistingData['age'] = input['age'];\nexistingData['isSingle'] = input['isSingle'];\nexistingData['country'] = input['country'];\n\nconsole.log(existingData);\n</code></pre>\n<p>When I run it, this is what I see:</p>\n<pre><code>{\n    name: 'Mike',\n    age: null,\n    isSingle: false,\n    country: 'France'\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>This is what I expect:</p>\n<pre><code>{\n    name: 'Mike',\n    age: 32,\n    isSingle: false,\n    country: 'France'\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>So my question is what value should I provide to input age in order to keep the value 32.\nI tried null but it does not work.</p>\n<p>Is there any possible way to solve this ?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":113,"question_id":65040605,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have form where user can add as much as he wants documents. Each document have several inputs.\nAnd I'm trying to get each document inputs values and put it to state as array of objects.\nState should look like:</p>\n<pre><code>[\n   {\n      id: 'UGN2WP68P1',\n      name: 'passport',\n      placeIssue: 'paris'\n   },\n   {\n      id: 'TD0KUWWIM6',\n      name: 'shengen visa',\n      placeIssue: 'paris'\n   }\n   ...\n]\n</code></pre>\n<p>So I write a function which is called on inputs change. He check are there object with same id, if there is no object with same id he creates new and add to array, if object exist with same id then he update object:</p>\n<pre><code>const addNewDocumentObj = (id, type, val) =&gt; {\n        // Get object with same id\n        let docObj = addedDocsArr.filter( el =&gt; el.id === id)\n        \n        // If there is no object with same id, creates new one\n        if (docObj.length === 0) {\n            if (type === 'name'){\n                let obj = {\n                    id: id,\n                    docId: val.id\n                }\n                setAddedDocsArr(addedDocsArr.concat(obj))\n            } else if (type === 'placeIssue') {\n                let obj = {\n                    id: id,\n                    placeIssue: val\n                }\n                setAddedDocsArr(addedDocsArr.concat(obj))\n            }\n        // If object exist with same id then updates with new value and adds to array\n        } else {\n            if (type === 'name'){\n                let newObject = Object.assign(docObj, {name: val.id})\n                let newArray = addedDocsArr.filter(el =&gt; el.id !== id)\n                setAddedDocsArr(newArray.concat(newObject))\n            } else if (type === 'placeIssue') {\n                let newObject = Object.assign(docObj, {placeIssue: val})\n                let newArray = addedDocsArr.filter(el =&gt; el.id !== id)\n                setAddedDocsArr(newArray.concat(newObject))\n            } \n        }\n    }\n</code></pre>\n<p>But it doesn't work, and I can't understand why, maybe my logic is bad and there is better practise?</p>\n<p>UPDATE:\nIn React debugger I noticed how state changes. If I add select document name, in state object looks like that:</p>\n<pre><code>{name: 'passport', id: 'UGN2WP68P1'}\n</code></pre>\n<p>If I enter document place of issue value. Then object changes and show data like that:</p>\n<pre><code>{placeIssue: 'paris', id: 'UGN2WP68P1'}\n</code></pre>\n<p>But result should be:</p>\n<pre><code>{name: 'passport', placeIssue: 'paris', id: 'UGN2WP68P1'}\n</code></pre>\n<p>So it looks like that object not updated but created new one</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":114,"question_id":65040582,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I just know that when using <code>useState</code>'s state is updated, fired component and its child components are also re-render. But when wrote this code , somehow update like this console log.</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>import { useState } from 'react';\nimport logo from './logo.svg';\nimport './App.css';\nimport { ChildA } from './ChildA.jsx';\nimport { ChildB } from './ChildB.jsx';\n\n\nfunction App() {\n  console.log('Parent render!')\n  const [countA, setCountA] = useState(0);\n  const [countB, setCountB] = useState(0);\n\n  const asyncJustReturnNull = async () =&gt; {\n    return null;\n  }\n\n  const countUpDouble = () =&gt; {\n    setCountA(countA + 1);\n    asyncJustReturnNull().then(() =&gt; {\n      setCountA(countA + 1);\n      setCountB(countB + 1);\n    })\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;App&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;header className=&quot;App-header&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;img src={logo} className=&quot;App-logo&quot; alt=&quot;logo&quot; /&gt;\n        &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; countUpDouble()}&gt;\n          Update A and B at the same time.\n        &lt;/button&gt;\n        &lt;ChildA /&gt;\n        countA is {countA}\n        &lt;ChildB /&gt;\n        countB is {countB}\n      &lt;/header&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  );\n}\n\nexport default App;\n\n</code></pre>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/eU28o.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/eU28o.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>CodePen is below.\n<a href=\"https://codepen.io/showgotagami/pen/qBaBveG\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://codepen.io/showgotagami/pen/qBaBveG</a></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":115,"question_id":65040562,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I have a TypeScript project that uses CryptoJS library. By default, Node now expects my import in <code>server.js</code> to be</p>\n<pre><code>import {fribbity} from './fribbity.js'\n</code></pre>\n<p>Are there settings I can apply in <code>package.json</code>, or on the <code>node</code> command line, that would enable node to resolve the imports as they were originally written? The reason why I think I have to add it to the main.ts is that I need to run it on application start, not at every db connection.</p>\n<pre><code>import { Module, Inject } from '@nestjs/common'\nimport { MongoClient, Db } from 'mongodb'\n\n@Module({\n  providers: [\n    {\n      provide: 'DATABASE_CLIENT',\n      useFactory: () =&gt; ({ client: null })\n    },\n    {\n      provide: 'DATABASE_CONNECTION',\n      inject: ['DATABASE_CLIENT'],\n      useFactory: async (dbClient): Promise&lt;Db&gt; =&gt; {\n        try {\n          const client = await MongoClient.connect('mongodb://localhost:27017')\n          dbClient.client = client\n          const db = client.db('database')\n          return db\n        } catch (error) {\n          console.error(error)\n          throw error\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  ],\n  exports: ['DATABASE_CONNECTION', 'DATABASE_CLIENT']\n})\nexport class DatabaseModule {\n  constructor(@Inject('DATABASE_CLIENT') private dbClient) {}\n  async onModuleDestroy() {\n    await this.dbClient.client.close()\n  }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>With that I can use my db in every other module, but that doesn't help me to get db connection at start up of the application:</p>\n<pre><code>import { Module } from '@nestjs/common'\nimport { MyService } from './my.service'\nimport { MyResolvers } from './my.resolvers'\nimport { DatabaseModule } from '../database.module'\n\n@Module({\n  imports: [DatabaseModule],\n  providers: [MyService, MyResolvers]\n})\nexport class MyModule {}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":120,"question_id":65040479,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I needed to create a pseudo-select element that displays columns for each row in the select. Since HTML does not allow the <code>&lt;option&gt;</code> tag to contain HTML, I had to take this approach.</p>\n<p>One of the features of a normal select element is that it folds up when you click outside the element, no matter where the user clicks. It can be within the document, it can be in the address bar, or wherever. I am having trouble duplicating that behavior. Controlling inside the document is easy. But clicking in the address bar or even in the developer/console window, it doesn't work.</p>\n<p>Please find my code below and a working fiddle.</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;style&gt;\n        .selectedOrder {\n            height: 30px; \n            display:none; \n        }\n\n    /* class applies to select element itself, not a wrapper element */\n    .select-css {\n        font-size: 12px;\n        font-family: sans-serif;\n        font-weight: 700;\n        color: #444;\n        line-height: 1.3;\n        padding: .6em 1.4em .5em .8em;\n        /* width: 100%; */\n        max-width: 100%; /* useful when width is set to anything other than 100% */\n        box-sizing: border-box;\n        margin: 0;\n        border: 1px solid #aaa;\n        box-shadow: 0 1px 0 1px rgba(0,0,0,.04);\n        border-radius: .5em;\n        -moz-appearance: none;\n        -webkit-appearance: none;\n        appearance: none;\n        background-color: #fff;\n        /* note: bg image below uses 2 urls. The first is an svg data uri for the arrow icon, and the second is the gradient. \n            for the icon, if you want to change the color, be sure to use `%23` instead of `#`, since it's a url. You can also swap in a different svg icon or an external image reference\n            \n        */\n        background-image: url('data:image/svg+xml;charset=US-ASCII,%3Csvg%20xmlns%3D%22http%3A%2F%2Fwww.w3.org%2F2000%2Fsvg%22%20width%3D%22292.4%22%20height%3D%22292.4%22%3E%3Cpath%20fill%3D%22%23007CB2%22%20d%3D%22M287%2069.4a17.6%2017.6%200%200%200-13-5.4H18.4c-5%200-9.3%201.8-12.9%205.4A17.6%2017.6%200%200%200%200%2082.2c0%205%201.8%209.3%205.4%2012.9l128%20127.9c3.6%203.6%207.8%205.4%2012.8%205.4s9.2-1.8%2012.8-5.4L287%2095c3.5-3.5%205.4-7.8%205.4-12.8%200-5-1.9-9.2-5.5-12.8z%22%2F%3E%3C%2Fsvg%3E'),\n          linear-gradient(to bottom, #ffffff 0%,#e5e5e5 100%);\n        background-repeat: no-repeat, repeat;\n        /* arrow icon position (1em from the right, 50% vertical) , then gradient position*/\n        background-position: right .7em top 50%, 0 0;\n        /* icon size, then gradient */\n        background-size: .65em auto, 100%;\n    }\n    /* Hide arrow icon in IE browsers */\n    .select-css::-ms-expand {\n        display: none;\n    }\n    /* Hover style */\n    .select-css:hover {\n        border-color: #888;\n    }\n    /* Focus style */\n    .select-css:focus {\n        border-color: #aaa;\n        /* It'd be nice to use -webkit-focus-ring-color here but it doesn't work on box-shadow */\n        box-shadow: 0 0 1px 3px rgba(59, 153, 252, .7);\n        box-shadow: 0 0 0 3px -moz-mac-focusring;\n        color: #222; {"body":"<p>I have the following code that allows you to <code>merge</code> a theme, what I would like to do is to be able to pass an undefined number of themes.</p>\n<p>How can I do?</p>\n<p>Code:</p>\n<pre><code>  const mergeTheme = (baseTheme, theme, darkTheme) =&gt; ({\n    ...Object.entries(baseTheme).reduce(\n      (acc, [key, value]) =&gt; ({\n        ...acc,\n        [key]: {\n          ...value,\n          ...(theme[key] || {}),\n          ...(darkTheme[key] || {}),\n        },\n      }),\n      {},\n    ),\n  })\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>As I'd like it to be, the input parameters:</p>\n<pre><code>  const mergeTheme = (baseTheme, ...theme) =&gt; ({\n    ...Object.entries(baseTheme).reduce(\n      (acc, [key, value]) =&gt; ({\n        ...acc,\n        [key]: {\n          ...value,\n\n          &lt;- Here\n\n        },\n      }),\n      {},\n    ),\n  })\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":122,"question_id":65040472,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>HTML5 form validation will not cover the situation where, starting from a group of checkboxes, at least one of them is checked. If a checkbox has the required attribute it must be checked, this is what I can get at most.\nSo I built a workaround that works fine (code in the snippet). The issue is that this works for one group of checkboxes. But I want my code to be valid even if I add more chackboxes groups. I need a suggestion on how to make it valid for multiple groups.\nAny idea?</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function bindItemsInput() {\n    var inputs = document.querySelectorAll('[name=\"option[]\"]')\n    var radioForCheckboxes = document.getElementById('radio-for-checkboxes')\n    function checkCheckboxes () {\n        var isAtLeastOneServiceSelected = false;\n        for(var i = inputs.length-1; i &gt;= 0; --i) {\n            if (inputs[i].checked) isAtLeastOneCheckboxSelected = true;\n        }\n        radioForCheckboxes.checked = isAtLeastOneCheckboxSelected\n    }\n    for(var i = inputs.length-1; i &gt;= 0; --i) {\n        inputs[i].addEventListener('change', checkCheckboxes)\n    }\n}\nbindItemsInput() // call in window onload</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>.checkboxs-wrapper {\n  position: relative;\n}\n.checkboxs-wrapper input[name=\"radio-for-required-checkboxes\"] {\n    position: absolute;\n    margin: 0;\n    top: 0;\n    left: 0;\n    width: 100%;\n    height: 100%;\n    -webkit-appearance: none;\n    pointer-events: none;\n    border: none;\n    background: none;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;form&gt;\n  &lt;div class=\"checkboxs-wrapper\"&gt;\n    &lt;input id=\"radio-for-checkboxes\" type=\"radio\" name=\"radio-for-required-checkboxes\" required/&gt;\n    &lt;input type=\"checkbox\" name=\"option[]\" value=\"option1\"/&gt;\n    &lt;input type=\"checkbox\" name=\"option[]\" value=\"option2\"/&gt;\n    &lt;input type=\"checkbox\" name=\"option[]\" value=\"option3\"/&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n  &lt;input type=\"submit\" value=\"submit\"/&gt;\n&lt;/form&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>A second snippet with the relevant HTML (<em>not working, goal of the question is to fix this</em>). <strong>It will have now the same ID for the radio button: that is invalid and is the reason of the question</strong>:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function bindItemsInput() {\n    var inputs = document.querySelectorAll('[name=\"option[]\"]')\n    var radioForCheckboxes = document.getElementById('radio-for-checkboxes')\n    function checkCheckboxes () {\n        var isAtLeastOneServiceSelected = false;\n        for(var i = inputs.length-1; {"body":"<p>I'm using puppeteer to make a bot that can check for my college homework. This error originated either by throwing inside of an async function without a catch block, or by rejecting a promise which was not handled with .catch(). To terminate the node process on unhandled promise rejection, use the CLI flag `--unhandled-rejections=strict` (see https://nodejs.org/api/cli.html#cli_unhandled_rejections_mode). (rejection id: 1)\n(node:16992) [DEP0018] DeprecationWarning: Unhandled promise rejections are deprecated. In the future, promise rejections that are not handled will terminate the Node.js process with a non-zero exit code.\n</code></pre>\n<p>What could be causing this?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":132,"question_id":65040239,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>Imagine I have two files:</p>\n<pre><code>// a.ts\n\nconst config = require('config').init()\nconst b = require('./b')\n</code></pre>\n<pre><code>// b.ts\n\nconst config = require('config').init()\n</code></pre>\n<p>If I was to compile this using <code>tsc</code> it gives me the following error:</p>\n<pre><code>a.ts:1:7 - error TS2451: Cannot redeclare block-scoped variable 'config'.\n\n1 const config = require('config').init()\n        ~~~~~~\n\n  b.ts:1:7\n    1 const config = require('config').init()\n            ~~~~~~\n    'config' was also declared here.\n\nb.ts:1:7 - error TS2451: Cannot redeclare block-scoped variable 'config'.\n\n1 const config = require('config').init()\n        ~~~~~~\n\n  a.ts:1:7\n    1 const config = require('config').init()\n            ~~~~~~\n    'config' was also declared here.\n</code></pre>\n<p>This seems to suggest it considers <code>a.js</code> and <code>b.js</code> to be in the same scope, which is inaccurate in the CommonJS system.  Is there a way I can encourage <code>tsc</code> to consider my files as scopes to stop this issue happening?</p>\n<p>I'm converting an archaic code base, so converting all the require statements to imports would take an eternity and I'd rather do it bit by bit, instead of all at once.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":134,"question_id":65040205,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

       &lt;div class=&quot;data-preview-text-3&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;h5&gt;\n              Lorem ipsum dolor sit.\n            &lt;/h5&gt;\n            &lt;h6&gt;\n              Lorem ipsum dolor sit.\n              Lorem ipsum dolor sit.\n              Lorem ipsum dolor sit.\n              Lorem ipsum dolor sit.\n              Lorem ipsum dolor sit.\n              Lorem ipsum dolor sit.\n {"body":"<p>I have a html graphing calculator that was relatively easy to create. I created an iframe and a textbox that held the code for a viewer to interact with. The system that was working before I put in the textbox and iframe but is now is acting buggy and not working properly. It could be I broke pieces of the code while transferring it, but I could not find the individual problems. The problems I noticed is that the system does not correctly graph on the y axis, whereas it did before (I fixed this problem by dividing the y-axis calculated by 13, but still am interested why it was higher than normal). Also, when I delete a number on one of the inputs after graphing once, the content of the iframe disappears, but reappears when I change the size of the page. Interestingly, if the size of the page is not your regular desktop, it does not disappear(I did not try any larger computers). I thought I may have done something wrong with the z-indexes I set but couldn't find any problems there. Does anyone know why I am running into these problems? Currently I am guessing that is is some king of loading problem for the iframe. The code is below;</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html&gt;\n    &lt;head&gt;\n        &lt;title&gt;GCalcScratchpad&lt;/title&gt;\n        &lt;style&gt;\n            body {\n                font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace;\n            }\n            hr {\n                border-top: 3px solid #bbb;\n            }\n            iframe {\n                width: 100%;\n                height: 600px;\n                border: none;\n            }\n            textarea {\n                resize: none;\n                float: right;\n                width: 80%;\n                height: 1800px;\n                margin-bottom: 5px;\n            }\n            div {\n                width: 18%;\n                float: left;\n            }\n            button {\n                width: 100%;\n                text-align: left;\n                margin-top: 4px;\n            }\n            p {\n                font-size: smaller;\n            }\n        &lt;/style&gt;\n    &lt;/head&gt;\n    &lt;body&gt;\n        &lt;iframe id=&quot;program&quot;&gt;&lt;/iframe&gt;\n        &lt;hr&gt;\n        &lt;h2&gt;My Coding&lt;/h2&gt;\n        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;button onclick=&quot;run()&quot;&gt;Run Program&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;button onclick=&quot;fullScreen()&quot;&gt;Fullscreen&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;The buttons above will run any changes to the code made in the textbox or resize to fullscreen.&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;h3&gt;CSS&lt;/h3&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;This CSS is mostly beginner friendly, with one aspect of it slightly more complex. The majority of the CSS is me sizing divs and changing the body to a font and background color I like. I use z-index in this program too to make so that the graphed line does not go over text I do not want it to. There is also the #topGraph &gt; div, which makes so that I can create other two pixel by two pixel divs using Javascript. I use this for the graphed line.&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;h3&gt;HTML&lt;/h3&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;The HTML is more beginner friendly, just basic HTML elements. These elements consist of divs (to keep the content uniform and avoid the graphed lines covering other content as well as to create the blank graph), text (to inform the viewer how to use the program), buttons (as a form of text to display the formula and to trigger functions) and inputs for your y-intercept and slope. These simple peices form the basics of the HTML.&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;h3&gt;Javascript&lt;/h3&gt;\n            &lt;p&gt;The Javascript is more complex. It uses functions that calculate the basic formula to make the graph and to actually graph the points of the graph. It then uses your button's onclick function to take your input values and runs those values using the functions listed before.&lt;/p&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;textarea class=&quot;code&quot; id=&quot;code&quot;&gt;\n&lt;html&gt;\n    &lt;head&gt;\n        &lt;style&gt;\n            /* This changes the body's font to one I think is more fitting for the program. */\n            body {\n                font-family: 'Courier New', Courier, monospace;\n                background-color: white;\n            }\n            /* This changes the width of every div. I use this to make the text look nicer. */\n            div {\n                width: 400px;\n                background-color: #fff;\n                z-index: 2;\n            }\n            /* This div is used in Javascript to create the graphed lines. */\n            #topGraph &gt; div {\n                height: 2px;\n                width: 2px;\n                z-index: 0;\n            }\n            /* This div I use to create the bottom portion of this div. The download for the images I used is below. */\n            #bottomGraph {\n                position: relative;\n                height: 31px; \n                width: 441px; \n                background: url('../Pictures/grid2.png'); \n                margin-left: 10px; \n                margin-bottom: 10px;\n                z-index: -2;\n            }\n            /* This div makes it so that the graphed line does not cover up the text. */\n            .noLine {\n                width:  550px;\n                background-color: #fff;\n                z-index: 2;\n            }\n        &lt;/style&gt;\n    &lt;/head&gt;\n    &lt;body&gt;\n        &lt;!-- This div works similarly to the styling that I used on the divs in general except in CSS I made it slightly wider so that it could hold the length of the formula. --&gt;\n        &lt;div class=&quot;noLine&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;!-- This div shortens the width of the text so that it matches the rest of the page. The text inside gives instructions to the viewer which inform him how to use the page. --&gt;\n            &lt;div&gt;\n                &lt;h2&gt;Slope-Intercept Graphing Calculator&lt;/h2&gt;\n                &lt;p&gt;Put in your slope and your y-intercept. If you have a direct equation do not leave the y-intercept blank. Instead put in a zero. Then click the run button. Below is the code I used explained.&lt;/p&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;!-- The rest of these buttons make a visible formula to the viewer. The inputs have an id so that the Javascript can access their contents. The 'run' button allows the viewer to run the program using a function linked to the onclick aspect. --&gt;\n            &lt;button&gt;{ y =&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;input id=&quot;slope&quot; /&gt;\n            &lt;button&gt;x +&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;input id=&quot;y_intercept&quot; /&gt;\n            &lt;button&gt;= ? }&lt;/button&gt;\n            &lt;button onclick=&quot;run()&quot;&gt;run&lt;/button&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;!-- This div serves as the main graph picture (pictures are available for download below). The styling is in the div itself. --&gt;\n        &lt;div id=&quot;topGraph&quot; style=&quot;position: relative; height: 271px; width: 441px; background: url('../Pictures/grid.png'); margin-left: 10px; margin-top: 10px; z-index: -1&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;!-- This div serves as the graph underneath y axis 0. This time the styling is in the style tags. --&gt;\n        &lt;div id=&quot;bottomGraph&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;Script&gt;\n            // The first function I use is one that calculates the basic formula of a 2-dimensional graph; y=mx+b (basic algebra).\n            function calculate_y(m, x, b) {\n                return (m*x)+parseFloat(b);\n            }\n            // Then I create I second function that calculates what answer we would get every time y is given a new value using a for statement. Each new y value is 0.004 higher. Then each value x and y is mapped out on the div 'topGraph' and the point is shown using divs I've shown before in the CSS portion. These divs are solid black and 2 pixels by two pixels. I give it a z-index of -1 so that I can set a div with a background of white to a higher z-index to avoid lines going over that div. I use this to avoid lines going over text that I do not want it to.\n            function multiple_x_s(m, b) {\n                for (x = -3; x &lt; 10; x += 0.004) {\n                    y = calculate_y(m, x, b);\n                    var new_div = document.createElement('div');\n                    new_div.style.height = 4;\n                    new_div.style.width = 4;\n                    new_div.style.position = 'absolute';\n                    new_div.style.left = x*130+'px';\n                    new_div.style.bottom = y*130+'px';\n                    new_div.style.background = 'black';\n                    new_div.style.zIndex = '1';\n                    document.getElementById('topGraph').appendChild(new_div);\n                }\n            }\n            // This function runs when you click the button (via onclick). This function runs the other two functions I described and set certain values using the ids of the input tags.\n            function run() {\n                var slope = document.getElementById(&quot;slope&quot;).value; \n                var y_intercept = document.getElementById(&quot;y_intercept&quot;).value;\n                multiple_x_s(slope, y_intercept/13);\n            }\n        &lt;/Script&gt;\n    &lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n        &lt;/textarea&gt;\n        &lt;script&gt;\n            window.onload = function() {\n                document.getElementById(&quot;program&quot;).srcdoc = document.getElementById(&quot;code&quot;).value\n            }\n            function run() {\n                document.getElementById(&quot;program&quot;).srcdoc = document.getElementById(&quot;code&quot;).value\n            }\n            function fullScreen() {\n                document.getElementById(&quot;program&quot;).requestFullscreen()\n            }\n        &lt;/script&gt;\n    &lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>EDIT1; I have tested this on multiple browsers and learned that the problem seems to only occur in Chrome, which leads me to believe that this is a bug in Google Chrome.</p>\n<p>EDIT2; I have tested this when the number I delete is zero or letters and the program continues to work. It is only when I delete real numbers that the program fails. I have also tested using different forms of input such as the textarea but this did not fix the problem.</p>\n<p>EDIT3; I tried deleting the &quot;DOCTYPE html&quot; tags and the &quot;html&quot; tags and the program still has the same bug. The rest of the program works however.</p>\n<p>EDIT4; I tried making so that the overflow of the body is hidden, which seemed to eliminate the problem. I am still unsure what this fixed, but the entire program works now. Thankyou to everyone who helped. :)</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":144,"question_id":65040017,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have a <code>Cell</code> component and when I click on it I want some popup window named <code>ChangeParamWindow</code> to appear. <code>ChangeParamWindow</code> has 2 buttons and if any of them was clicked I want to refresh value in the <code>Cell</code> to refresh from the popup input &amp; <code>ChangeParamWindow</code> change its display to <code>none</code> if it is <code>block </code> (for hiding block). It hides itself succesfully only one time, but never again. I am pretty sure that using prevState somehow wrong, but could abybody tell me what I am doing wrong?</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"true\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>class ChangeParamWindow extends React.Component {\n  constructor(props) {\n    super(props)\n    this.onClose = this.onClose.bind(this);\n    this.state = {\n      placeholder: \"Param...\",\n      maxlength  : 100,\n      inputType  : \"text\",\n      type       : \"any\",  // number or string. (for restritions)\n      value      : null,\n      outline    : \"none\",\n      position   : \"absolute\",\n      display    : \"block\"\n    }\n    this.inputId = \"small-window-input-id\"\n  }\n  onClose(e) {\n    e.preventDefault()\n    let value = document.getElementById(this.inputId).value\n    console.log(\"new value is\", value)\n\n    this.setState(prevState =&gt; ({\n      display : (prevState.display == \"none\") ? \"display\" : \"none\", // TODO ???\n      value   : value\n    }))\n  }\n  render(){\n    return (\n        &lt;div\n        style={{\n            display  : this.state.display,\n            position : this.state.position,\n            outline  : this.state.outline,\n            left     : this.props.x,\n            top      : this.props.y\n        }}\n        &gt;\n          &lt;input\n              id={this.inputId}\n              maxLength={this.state.maxlength}\n              type={this.state.inputType}\n              placeholder={this.state.placeholder}\n          /&gt;\n          &lt;input\n              onClick={ this.onClose }\n              type=\"submit\"\n              value=\"ok\"\n          /&gt;\n          &lt;input\n              onClick={this.onClose }\n              type=\"submit\"\n              value=\"cancel\"\n          /&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    )\n  }\n}\n\nclass Cell extends React.Component {\n  constructor(props) {\n    super(props)\n    this.state = {\n      value   : null,\n      type    : \"any\",\n      noValue : \"...\"\n    }\n  }\n  openChangeParamWindow(x, y) {\n    ReactDOM.render(\n        &lt;ChangeParamWindow\n          x={x}\n          y={y}\n        /&gt;,\n        document.getElementById(\"change-param-window\")\n    )\n  }\n  isNumberValid() {\n\n  }\n  isStringValid() {\n\n  }\n  render() {\n    let value = (this.state.value == null) ? this.state.noValue : this.state.value;\n    return (\n      &lt;div\n          className=\"cell\"\n          onClick={event =&gt; {\n            this.openChangeParamWindow(event.clientX, event.clientY)\n          }}\n      &gt;\n        {value}\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    );\n  }\n}\n\nReactDOM.render(\n    &lt;Cell /&gt;,\n    document.getElementById('init-cell')\n);</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>.cell {\n    background:grey;\n    border-radius: 7px;\n    border:0;\n    transition: 0.25s;\n    width:40px;\n    height:25px;\n    text-align: center;\n    padding-top:5px;\n}\n.cell:hover {\n    cursor: pointer;\n    background:white;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://unpkg.com/react@17/umd/react.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://unpkg.com/react-dom@17/umd/react-dom.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"change-param-window\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"init-cell\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":145,"question_id":65040009,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have this javascript code that make a get request. It works fine.</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>export const getReq = () =&gt; {\n  fetch(\n    'https://api.github.com/repos/javascript-tutorial/en.javascript.info/commits',\n  )\n    .then((response) =&gt; {\n      let status = null;\n      if (response.status === 200) {\n        status = response.status;\n      } else {\n        status = 'error';\n      }\n      if (status === 200) {\n        alert('success');\n      } else {\n        alert('Error');\n      }\n      return response.json();\n    })\n    .then((commits) =&gt; {\n      return commits.map(({sha}) =&gt; sha)[0];\n    });\n};</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>I want to test if my function that fetch was called:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>import { getReq } from './getReq';\n\njest.mock('./getReq', () =&gt; ({\n    getReq: () =&gt; 123\n}));\n\ndescribe('success', () =&gt; {\n  test('check if was caled', async () =&gt; {\n    const sha = await getReq();\n     expect(sha).toHaveBeenCalled();\n  });\n});</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>Doing this test i get the next error:\n<code>Matcher error: received value must be a mock or spy function</code><br>\nHow to test if my function that make a <code>get</code> request was called?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":146,"question_id":65039971,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>First of all, I know that <code>position: sticky</code> exists. I'm not trying to create a sticky header or menu; I'm trying to create a <strong>sticky scrollbar</strong>.</p>\n<h2>Problem</h2>\n<p>I have a narrow container that contains nicely formatted data and sometimes contains wide tables. I have no control over the tables' content, number of columns/rows, or the width of the parent container.</p>\n<p>To show the content of the table, normally one would <strong>add a horizontal scrollbar to the whole container</strong> and call it a day. The problem with this approach is that after scrolling right, other children of this container would be shifted left, making them invisible.</p>\n<p>So the logical next idea is to <strong>add a scrollbar to each table</strong>. It works very well for short tables, but as soon as you stumble upon a tall one, the horizontal scrollbar is nowhere to be seen. You'd have to scroll all the way to the bottom of the table, scroll right, and then scroll back up to see what you missed.</p>\n<p>What I thought of is <strong>a scrollbar that would appear when it's needed, and disappear when the wide table is no longer visible</strong>. Since there can be multiple tables in the container, each would need to have a horizontal scrollbar stuck to it.</p>\n<h2>Question</h2>\n<p>Putting aside the story above, including the concept of <a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XY_problem\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">XY problem</a> – how would one implement something like this?</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/PuoDM.gif\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/PuoDM.gif\" alt=\"Animated GIF showing a sticky secondary scrollbar\" /></a></p>\n<p>I thought of the following solution:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Monitor the position of the table in the container</li>\n<li>When more than 20 px of the table is visible, attach a transparent floating div to its bottom</li>\n<li>If the div is not fully &quot;visible&quot; in the container, move it up so it is</li>\n<li>Set that div's width to match the wide table, so it has a scrollbar</li>\n<li>Control the table's position using that div's scrollbar</li>\n</ul>\n<p>It feels incredibly hacky and prone to errors, though. Is there another approach that would work reliably?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":147,"question_id":65039952,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I am trying to migrate my angularJS application, where I have used Requirejs.\nDoes requirejs support Components? I am unable to find proper docs related to this.</p>\n<p>I am getting error when I try to use a component in my Requirejs module.\n&quot;require.js:900 TypeError: app.component is not a function&quot;</p>\n<pre><code>define(['app/config',\n        'app/ideasDataSvc',\n        'app/ideasHomeController',\n        'app/ideaDetailsController'],\n    function(config, ideasDataSvc, demo, ideaDetailsController){\n    'use strict';\n\n    var app = angular.module('ideasApp', ['ngRoute','ngResource','ngGrid']);\n\n    app.config(config);\n    app.factory('ideasDataSvc',ideasDataSvc);\n    app.component('demo', demo);\n    app.controller('ideaDetailsController',ideaDetailsController);\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p>Please shed some light</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":148,"question_id":65039949,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>When I hover <code>li</code> with number <code>3</code> I get wrong number for <code>next id</code> in <code>img</code>. On first hover I get <code>next id</code> = 4, that's wrong. On second hover I get <code>next id</code> = 0 that's what I need.\nHow to make correctly <code>next id</code> on hover like a carousel</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>let chosen_li = [];\nlet next_id;\n\n$(\".navigate li\").on(\"mouseover\", function () {\n  let li = $(this);\n\n  let index_li = li.index();\n\n  chosen_li.unshift(index_li);\n  if (chosen_li.length &gt; 2) {\n    chosen_li.pop();\n  }\n  if (chosen_li[0] !== chosen_li[1]) {\n    $(\"#slider #img_\" + chosen_li[0])\n      .prependTo(\"#slider\")\n  }\n  /////how to get next id?\n  next_id =\n    next_id &gt; $(\".navigate li\").length - 1\n      ? 0\n      : parseInt($(\"#slider\").children().attr(\"id\").split(\"_\")[1], 10) + 1;\n\n  console.log(next_id);\n  $(\"#slider #img_\" + next_id).insertAfter($(\"#slider img:first\"));\n});</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.3.1/jquery.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"slider\"&gt;\n    &lt;img id=\"img_0\" src=\"1.jpg\" style=\"margin-left:10px\"&gt;\n    &lt;img id=\"img_1\" src=\"2.jpg\" style=\"margin-left:20px\"&gt;\n    &lt;img id=\"img_2\" src=\"3.jpg\" style=\"margin-left:30px\"&gt;\n    &lt;img id=\"img_3\" src=\"4.jpg\" style=\"margin-left:40px\"&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n\n&lt;ul class=\"navigate\"&gt;\n    &lt;li&gt;0&lt;/li&gt;\n    &lt;li&gt;1&lt;/li&gt;\n    &lt;li&gt;2&lt;/li&gt;\n    &lt;li&gt;3&lt;/li&gt;\n&lt;/ul&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":149,"question_id":65039943,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

             transition: background 0.2s linear, color 0.2 ease-out;\n\n                &amp;:hover{\n                    background: lightblue;\n                    color: #171717;\n                }\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    \n   \n}\n\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>CSS</p>\n<pre><code>body {\n  margin: 0px;\n  padding: 0px;\n  background: white;\n  font-family: &quot;Roboto&quot;, Helvetica, sans-serif;\n}\n\n.page {\n  width: 100vw;\n  height: 100vh;\n  display: flex;\n  flex-flow: column;\n}\n\n.header {\n  width: 100vw;\n  height: 60px;\n  display: flex;\n  justify-content: center;\n  align-items: center;\n  background: #171717;\n}\n.header_title {\n  color: lightblue;\n  font-size: 20px;\n  font-weight: 900;\n}\n.header_title span {\n  font-weight: 300;\n}\n\n.main {\n  flex: 1;\n  overflow: scroll;\n}\n.main .slider {\n  position: relative;\n  overflow: hidden;\n  width: 100%;\n  height: 100%;\n}\n.main .slider_slide {\n  position: absolute;\n  transform: translateY(-100%);\n  left: 0;\n  width: 100%;\n  height: 100%;\n  overflow: hidden;\n  opacity: 0;\n  transition: transform 0.5s ease-in-out, opacity 0.5s linear;\n  background-position: center center;\n  background-size: cover;\n}\n.main .slider_slide.active {\n  opacity: 1;\n  transform: translateY(0%);\n}\n.main .slider_btns {\n  position: absolute;\n  z-index: 999;\n  top: 50%;\n  transform: translateY(-50%);\n  width: 100%;\n  padding: 15px;\n  box-sizing: border-box;\n  display: flex;\n  justify-content: space-between;\n}\n.main .slider_btns .slider_btn {\n  width: 35px;\n  height: 35px;\n  color: lightblue;\n  font-size: 20px;\n  line-height: 35px;\n  text-align: center;\n  font-weight: 300;\n  border-radius: 50%;\n  background: none;\n  border: 1px solid lightblue;\n  cursor: pointer;\n  transition: background 0.2s linear, color 0.2 ease-out;\n}\n.main .slider_btns .slider_btn:hover {\n  background: lightblue;\n  color: #171717;\n}\n\n/*# sourceMappingURL=slider.css.map */\n\n\n</code></pre>\n" {"body":"<p>I am using interceptor that refreshes the access token upon a status code of <code>401</code> but my <code>catch</code> has stopped working upon any other error codes such as <code>400</code></p>\n<p><strong>request.js</strong></p>\n<pre><code>import axios from 'axios'\n\nconst axiosApiInstance = axios.create()\n\naxiosApiInstance.interceptors.response.use(\n    (response) =&gt; {\n      return response\n    },\n    (error) =&gt; {\n      return new Promise((resolve) =&gt; {\n        const originalRequest = error.config\n        const refreshToken = localStorage.getItem(&quot;refresh&quot;)\n        if (error.response &amp;&amp; error.response.status === 401 &amp;&amp; error.config &amp;&amp; !error.config.__isRetryRequest &amp;&amp; refreshToken) {\n          originalRequest._retry = true\n  \n          const response = fetch('http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/token/refresh/', {\n            method: 'POST',\n            headers: {\n              'Content-Type': 'application/json',\n            },\n            body: JSON.stringify({\n              refresh: refreshToken,\n            }),\n          })\n            .then((res) =&gt; res.json())\n            .then((res) =&gt; {\n              localStorage.setItem(&quot;access&quot;, res.access) \n              originalRequest.headers['Authorization'] = 'Bearer ' + res.access\n              return axios(originalRequest)\n            })\n          resolve(response)\n        }\n        return Promise.reject(error)\n      })\n    },\n  )\n\n  export default axiosApiInstance\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":165,"question_id":65039588,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>While im getting imgs list from API by custom hook show loader component, then map list. {"body":"<p>When you create a class, and then instantiate it, and then request its string description, you get a result in the format <code>[object {type}]</code>. Here's an example:</p>\n<pre><code>function TestClass(){}\nvar instance_obj = new TestClass();\nObject.prototype.toString.call(instance_obj);\n\n// Output: [object Object]\n</code></pre>\n<p>Is there are cross-browser way to implement a custom description such that when I run the above code, I get the following?</p>\n<pre><code>[object TestClass]\n</code></pre>\n<p>So far, I've done this:</p>\n<pre><code>// Option 1\nfunction TestClass(){}\nvar instance_obj = new TestClass();\ninstance_obj[Symbol.toStringTag] = 'TestClass';\nObject.prototype.toString.call(instance_obj);\n\n// Output: [object TestClass]\n</code></pre>\n<p>...and also this:</p>\n<pre><code>// Option 2\nfunction TestClass(){}\nvar instance_obj = new TestClass();\nObject.defineProperty(TestClass.prototype, Symbol.toStringTag, {\n    value: &quot;TestClass&quot;\n});\nObject.prototype.toString.call(instance_obj);\n\n// Output: [object TestClass]\n</code></pre>\n<p><code>Option 2</code> appears the best option given that it does not expose a writable <code>Symbol.toStringTag</code> directly on the instance.</p>\n<p>However, according to the docs for <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Symbol/toStringTag#:%7E:text=The%20Symbol.,accessed%20internally%20by%20the%20Object.\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Symbol.toStringTag</a>, it appears to be a modern feature that won't work on most browsers.</p>\n<p>Is there a cross-browser [<code>&gt;=IE9</code>] way to implement this?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":174,"question_id":65039387,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
