{"body":"<p>When I call the method buildCommand, it does not return the property message, but I found out that if I remove some properties out of buildCommand, it works.\nThis is the method I call</p>\n<pre><code>const buildCommand = (commandJSON) =&gt; {\n        return new Command({\n        prefix: commandJSON.prefix,\n        command: commandJSON.command,\n        aliases: commandJSON.aliases,\n        parameters: commandJSON.parameters,\n        message: commandJSON.message,\n        response: commandJSON.response,\n        commandMedium: commandJSON.commandMedium,\n        enabled: commandJSON.enabled,\n        isDefault: commandJSON.isDefault,\n        permission: commandJSON.permission,\n        cooldown: commandJSON.cooldown,\n      });\n    };\n</code></pre>\n<p>This is how I call the method</p>\n<pre><code>const newCommand = buildCommand(commandJSON);\n</code></pre>\n<p>commandJSON looks like this</p>\n<pre><code>{ prefix: '!', command: 'laugh', message: 'hahaha' }\n</code></pre>\n<p>UPDATE 2\nHere is my whole Command Model</p>\n<pre><code>const mongoose = require('mongoose');\n\nconst commandSchema = mongoose.Schema({\n  prefix: {\n    type: String,\n    default: '!',\n  },\n  command: {\n    type: String,\n    required: true,\n  },\n  aliases: {\n    type: Array,\n  },\n  parameters: {\n    type: Array,\n  },\n  message: {\n    type: String,\n  },\n  response: {\n    type: String,\n    enum: ['chat', 'whisper'],\n    default: 'chat',\n  },\n  commandMedium: {\n    type: String,\n    enum: ['offline', 'online', 'both'],\n    default: 'both',\n  },\n  enabled: {\n    type: Boolean,\n    default: true,\n  },\n  isDefault: {\n    type: Boolean,\n    default: false,\n  },\n  permission: {\n    type: String,\n    enum: ['everyone', 'subscriber', 'vip', 'moderator', 'broadcaster'],\n    default: 'everyone',\n  },\n  cooldown: {\n    globalCooldown:{type:Boolean, default:false},\n    globalDuration:{type:Number, default:0},\n    userDuration:{type:Number,default:0},\n  }\n});\n\nmodule.exports = mongoose.model('Commands', commandSchema, 'TwitchUsers');\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":178,"question_id":65039320,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I have this code which is a bouncing ball that I can move with a mouse and it is supposed to work like a slingshot. The problems are: By dragging the ball I change ball speed to mouse speed but it happens even when I click blank space. Also the speed I get from the mouse is somehow not the one with which i move my mouse.  How do I change speed only when I hold the ball and calculate the speed of the whole mouse move?</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta charset=&quot;utf-8&quot; /&gt;\n&lt;/head&gt;\n&lt;body&gt;\n&lt;canvas id=&quot;myCanvas&quot; width=&quot;800&quot; height=&quot;800&quot;&gt;&lt;/canvas&gt;\n&lt;script&gt;\n    var canvas = document.getElementById(&quot;myCanvas&quot;);\n    var ctx = canvas.getContext(&quot;2d&quot;);\n    var ballRadius = 30;\n    var x = canvas.width/2;\n    var y = canvas.height-30;\n    var dx = 0;\n    var dy = 0;\n    var w=myCanvas.width;\n    var h=myCanvas.height;\n    var isDrag=false;\n    var offset={x:0,y:0};   \n    var totalX = 0;\n    var totalY = 0;\n    var moveX = 0;\n    var moveY = 0;\n    function drawBall() {\n        ctx.beginPath();\n       circle(x,y,ballRadius,'#c1153e');;\n        ctx.fillStyle = &quot;red&quot;;\n        ctx.fill();\n        ctx.closePath();\n    }\n    function draw() {\n        ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);\n        drawBall();\n        if(x + dx &gt; canvas.width-ballRadius || x + dx &lt; ballRadius) {\n            dx = -dx;\n        }\n        if(y + dy &gt; canvas.height-ballRadius || y + dy &lt; ballRadius) {\n            dy = -dy;\n        }\n        x += dx;\n        y += dy;\n    }\n    setInterval(draw, 15);  \n    function circle(x,y,ballRadius,color='black'){\n         ctx.clearRect(0,0,w,h) \n         ctx.fillStyle=color;\n         ctx.beginPath();\n         ctx.arc(x,y,ballRadius,0,2*Math.PI);\n         ctx.fill();\n     }\n     circle(x,y,ballRadius,'#c1153e');\n     myCanvas.onmousedown=function(e){\n         var m=get_mouse_coords(e);\n         circle(x,y,ballRadius,'green');\n         if ((x-m.x)*(x-m.x)+(y-m.y)*(y-m.y)&lt;ballRadius*ballRadius){\n             isDrag=true;\n             circle(x,y,ballRadius,'red');\n             offset.x=x-m.x;\n             offset.y=y-m.y;\n             x=m.x+offset.x;\n             y=m.y+offset.y;\n         }  \n     }\n     function get_mouse_coords(e){\n         var m={};\n         var rect=myCanvas.getBoundingClientRect();\n         m.x=e.clientX-rect.left;\n         m.y=e.clientY-rect.top;\n         //console.log(m);\n         return m;\n     }\n     myCanvas.onmousemove=function(e){\n        var m=get_mouse_coords(e); \n        if (isDrag) {\n        x=m.x;\n        y=m.y;      \n             x=m.x+offset.x;\n             y=m.y+offset.y;\n         circle(x,y,ballRadius,'red');      \n        }\n     }\n     myCanvas.onmouseup=function(e){\n        var m=get_mouse_coords(e);\n        isDrag=false;\n        dx=-totalX/300;\n        dy=-totalY/300;\n        circle(x,y,ballRadius);\n     }\n     \n     var totalX = 0;\n    var totalY = 0;\n    var moveX = 0;\n    var moveY = 0;\n\n    document.addEventListener(&quot;mousemove&quot;, function(ev){\n        totalX += Math.abs(ev.movementX);\n        totalY += Math.abs(ev.movementY);\n        moveX += ev.movementX;\n        moveY += ev.movementY;\n    }, false);\n\n    setInterval(function(){\n        console.log(`Speed X: ${totalX}px/s, Y: ${totalY}px/s`);\n        console.log(`Movement X: ${moveX}px/s, Y: ${moveY}px/s`);\n        moveX = moveY = totalX = totalY = 0;\n    }, 10000);\n     \n&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":179,"question_id":65039312,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I am a beginner in Reactjs and I am not finding the best way to save data from a dynamic form in ReactJS.\nThis form can only display 10 questions per page and when I move forward I have to save the answers on the current page.\nCan anybody help me?\nI was thinking of putting an ID on the form and then getting the component data....I have one form per component (inputs).</p>\n<p>This is how I try to code my function that will save the answers and how I render the dynamic inputs</p>\n<pre><code>     save = (currentIndex, pageNumber) =&gt; {\n\n            let {text=&quot;&quot;, id=&quot;&quot;} = this.form.model;\n            let answerText = text;\n            if(Array.isArray(answerText)){\n                text = JSON.stringify(text);\n                answerText = answerText.filter(item=&gt;!!item)\n                if(!answerText.length) answerText = &quot;&quot;;\n                else answerText = text;\n            }\n            saveAnswerAction({\n                answerId : id,\n                text: answerText,\n            }).then(()=&gt;{\n\n                return refresh();\n            }).catch(e=&gt;{\n                console.log(e);\n            });\n\n        }\n\n        render() {\n\n            if (this.state.answers) {\n                    var questions = this.state.answers.toJSON();\n                    var questionsToRender = [];\n\n                    var qInit = (this.state.currentPage * this.state.quantityQuestionsPerPage) - this.state.quantityQuestionsPerPage;\n                    var qEnd = this.state.currentPage * this.state.quantityQuestionsPerPage;\n\n                    if (qEnd &gt; questions.length) {\n                            qEnd = qInit + 1;\n                    }\n\n                    for (var i = qInit; i &lt; qEnd; i++) {\n                            var readOnly = false;\n                            let QuestionRender = QuestionRenderFactory(questions[i], i, readOnly);\n                            questionsToRender.push(&lt;QuestionRender ref={form=&gt;this.form=form} /&gt;)\n                    }\n\n\n                    return (\n                            &lt;div&gt;\n                                    {questionsToRender}\n                            &lt;/div&gt;\n                    )\n            }\n            else {\n                    return (\n                            &lt;div&gt;\n                                    NO QUESTIONS\n                            &lt;/div&gt;\n                    )\n            }\n\n        }\n\n\n</code></pre>\n<pre><code>    render() {\n        return (\n            &lt;div className={&quot;formId_&quot; + formId}&gt;\n                &lt;p className=&quot;question&quot;&gt;{questionAnswer.question.text} {questionAnswer.question.required ? &lt;span className=&quot;question-required&quot;&gt;* &lt;/span&gt;: null }&lt;/p&gt;        \n                { questionAnswer.question.help &amp;&amp; &lt;div className=&quot;help&quot;&gt;{questionAnswer.question.help}&lt;/div&gt; }\n                            \n                &lt;Form\n                    ref={form =&gt; this.form = form}\n                    value={this.state.model}\n                    onChange={model =&gt; this.setState({ model })}&gt;\n                    {fields}\n                &lt;/Form&gt;\n                &lt;br /&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n        )\n    }\n</code></pre>\n<p>I will have the HTML rendered:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;div class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\n   &lt;h3 class=&quot;title&quot;&gt;Form&lt;/h3&gt;\n\n   &lt;h3 class=&quot;subtitle&quot;&gt;Fields * are required&lt;/h3&gt;\n   &lt;br&gt;\n   &lt;div&gt;\n      &lt;div class=&quot;formId_0&quot;&gt;\n         &lt;p class=&quot;question&quot;&gt;\n           Question 1&lt;span class=&quot;question-required&quot;&gt;* &lt;/span&gt;\n         &lt;/p&gt;\n         &lt;div class=&quot;help&quot;&gt;help&lt;/div&gt;\n         &lt;form novalidate=&quot;&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;div class=&quot;input-container undefined undefined&quot;&gt;\n               &lt;div class=&quot;input-wrapper&quot;&gt;&lt;input name=&quot;text&quot; {"body":"<p>Well, practically what I want to do is test tensorFlow.js in a chrome extension, so I made a machine learning application using tensorFlow.js on a web page, to then implement it in an extension.</p>\n<p>but this error appears when I press the icon of my extension:\n<a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/6Z2yJ.jpg\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/6Z2yJ.jpg\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>I believe it is as if It were not recognizing the syntax of tensorFlow.js, since <strong>tf.sequential ();</strong> is already a ready function of the tfjs library.</p>\n<p>Could someone help me with this problem?</p>\n<p><strong>Here are the codes:</strong></p>\n<p>Manisfest.json:</p>\n<pre><code>{\n&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Teste implementacao extension&quot;,\n&quot;version&quot;:&quot;1.0&quot;,\n&quot;description&quot;:&quot;NULL for While&quot;,\n&quot;browser_action&quot;:{\n    &quot;default_popup&quot;:&quot;index.html&quot;\n},\n\n&quot;manifest_version&quot;:2,\n&quot;content_security_policy&quot;: &quot;script-src 'self' https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@tensorflow/tfjs@1.0.0/dist/tf.min.js 'sha256-AJlm0gxYKWeBb5choQtViwczPIiEm/8RF2tRQOdGGR4='; {"body":"<h3>Hey there! :)</h3>\n<p>I am using <a href=\"https://nextjs.org/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Next.js</a> to build a college dashboard that incorporates Teacher, Student and Admin dashboards.</p>\n<p>I have created a common Home page from where you can choose to login/signup as any of those. Since we have 3 different type of clients so we have these multiple dynamic routes for Authentication</p>\n<h2>What I want ?</h2>\n<p>I want the actual dashboard routes to be well protected if the client is not Authenticated i.e. <em>the client should not be able to access any of those routes if he/she is not Logged in.</em></p>\n<p>Also, If they did try to do the same they should get redirected to the <strong>Home</strong> page from where they can choose to further login/signup as a Teacher, Student or Admin.</p>\n<h2>What is the issue ?</h2>\n<p>I have a <code>user object</code> (<em>it is null if no user is loggen in</em>) using which I check whether a person is authenticated or not. So in my <strong>custom _app</strong> I am checking the same but when the user is not logged in I can redirect it to only a specific route say Home '/' which means if a person opted for say login as student he/she will again be redirected to the Home page which should not happen instead all the authentication related routes should be accessible.</p>\n<pre><code>import React from 'react';\nimport Home from './index';\nimport Head from 'next/head';\nimport Layout from &quot;../Components/Authentication/Layout&quot;;\nimport Layout2 from '../Components/SD_Comps/Layout';\nimport Layout3 from '../Components/EP_Comps/Layout';\nimport { useUser } from '../lib/hooks';\nimport { useRouter } from 'next/router';\nimport '../style.scss';\nimport '../node_modules/hover.css/css/hover-min.css';\n\nexport default function MyApp({ Component, pageProps }) {\n  const router = useRouter();\n  const [user] = useUser();\n\n  return (\n    &lt;&gt;\n      &lt;Head&gt;\n        &lt;link rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; href=&quot;https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/materialize/1.0.0/css/materialize.min.css&quot;&gt;&lt;/link&gt;\n        &lt;script src=&quot;https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/materialize/1.0.0/js/materialize.min.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n        &lt;link href=&quot;https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons&quot; rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot;&gt;&lt;/link&gt;\n        &lt;link href=&quot;https://stackpath.bootstrapcdn.com/font-awesome/4.7.0/css/font-awesome.min.css&quot; rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot;&gt;&lt;/link&gt;\n      &lt;/Head&gt;\n\n      {user ? {"body":"<p>(Old) I'm currently working on a side-scrolling shooter game in JS with platformer physics, I haven't added scrolling yet but I've started on the bullets. The issue is that the bullets suddenly fly off to the left side of the screen unless there's a wall there, that'll delete the bullet (so that bullets don't go through walls). I'm having trouble locating and fixing the bug, can anyone help?</p>\n<p><strong>EDIT</strong>: The main issue has been fixed, I had <em>=+</em> rather than <em>+=</em> so bullets instead get <em>set</em> to bulletSpeed. I'll be changing the discussion's topic now.</p>\n<p>(New) The bullets aren't correctly hitting the enemies and reducing HP/killing the enemy, any ideas why? Thanks.</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>            var CANVAS = document.getElementById(&quot;game&quot;);\n            var PANEL = CANVAS.getContext(&quot;2d&quot;);\n            CANVAS.width = screen.width + -2;\n            CANVAS.height = screen.height + -350;\n            var KEYS = {\n                right: false,\n                left: false,\n                up: false,\n                down: false,\n                space: false,\n            }\n            var x = Math.round(CANVAS.width / 2);\n            var y = Math.round(CANVAS.height / 2);\n            var velY = 0;\n            var velX = 0;\n            var maxVelX = 8;\n            var maxVelY = 30;\n            var lastMove = &quot;right&quot;;\n            var p = &quot;p&quot;;\n            var platforms = [\n                [ , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , ],\n                [p,p, ,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p, ,p,p],\n                [p, , , , , ,p, , ,p, , , ,p, , , , ,p],\n                [p,p,p, , , , , , , , , , , , , , , ,p],\n                [p, , , , , , ,p,p,p, , ,p,p, , , , ,p],\n                [p,p,p,p, , , , , , , , , , , , , , ,p],\n                [p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p,p],\n            ];\n            var platformsX = [];\n            var platformsY = [];\n            var bulletsX = [];\n            var bulletsY = [];\n            var bulletsDir = [];\n            var enmsX = [x - 100, x + 50];\n            var enmsY = [y, y];\n            var enmsVelY = [0, 0];\n            var enmsVelX = [0, 0];\n            var enmsMaxVelY = [30, 30];\n            var enmsMaxVelX = [8, 8];\n            var enmsHp = [1, 100];\n            var enmsLastMove = [&quot;right&quot;, &quot;right&quot;];\n            var tileLength = 75;\n            var playerHeight = 65;\n            var playerWidth = 50;\n            var bulletsWidth = 15;\n            var bulletsHeight = 10;\n            var img = new Image();\n            img.src = &quot;&quot;;\n            var frame = 0;\n            var reload = 0;\n            var fireRate = 10;\n            var bulletSpeed = 15;\n            var hp = 100;\n            window.onload=document.addEventListener('keydown',checkEventsKeyDown, false);\n            window.onload=document.addEventListener('keyup',checkEventsKeyUp, false);\n            window.onload=translatePlatforms();\n            window.onload=main\n\n            function main() {\n                update();\n                PANEL.clearRect(0, 0, CANVAS.width, CANVAS.height);\n                render();\n                requestAnimationFrame(main, CANVAS);\n            }\n            \n            function checkEventsKeyDown(e) {\n                if(e.keyCode == 37) {\n                    KEYS.left = true;\n                }\n                \n                if(e.keyCode == 38) {\n                    KEYS.up = true;\n                }\n                \n                if(e.keyCode == 40) {\n                    KEYS.down = true;\n                }\n                \n                if(e.keyCode == 39) {\n                    KEYS.right = true;\n                }\n\n                if(e.keyCode == 32) {\n                    KEYS.space = true;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function checkEventsKeyUp(e) {\n                if(e.keyCode == 37) {\n                    KEYS.left = false;\n                }\n                \n                if(e.keyCode == 38) {\n                    KEYS.up = false;\n                }\n                \n                if(e.keyCode == 40) {\n                    KEYS.down = false;\n                }\n                \n                if(e.keyCode == 39) {\n                    KEYS.right = false;\n                }\n\n                if(e.keyCode == 32) {\n                    KEYS.space = false;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function translatePlatforms() {\n                for (i = 0; i &lt; platforms.length; i++) {\n                    var line = platforms[i];\n                    for (i2 = 0; i2 &lt; line.length; i2++) {\n                        var letter = line[i2];\n                        if (letter == &quot;p&quot;) {\n                            platformsX.push(i2 * tileLength + (tileLength / 2));\n                            platformsY.push(i * tileLength + (tileLength / 2));\n                        }\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function update() {\n                \n                //gravity\n                ground();\n                if ((!wallCol()) &amp;&amp; (velY &lt;= maxVelY - 0.5)) {velY += 0.5};\n                \n                y += 1;\n                if (KEYS.up &amp;&amp; wallCol() &amp;&amp; velY &gt; 0) {\n                    velY = -15;\n                };\n                y += -1;\n                \n                y += Math.round(velY);\n                \n                //movement\n                if (velX&gt;0) {\n                    velX += -0.25;\n                }\n                \n                if (velX&lt;0) {\n                    velX += 0.25;\n                }\n                \n                if (KEYS.right &amp;&amp; velX&lt;=maxVelX) {\n                    velX += 0.5;\n                }\n                \n                if (KEYS.left &amp;&amp; velX&gt;=-maxVelX) {\n                    velX += -0.5;\n                }\n                if (velX &gt; maxVelX) {velX = maxVelX};\n                if (velX &lt; -maxVelX) {velX = -maxVelX};\n\n                if (KEYS.left) {\n                    lastMove = &quot;left&quot;;\n                }\n                if (KEYS.right) {\n                    lastMove = &quot;right&quot;;\n                }\n                \n                ground();\n\n                x += Math.round(velX);\n                if (wallCol()) {\n                    if (wallCol()) {\n                        while (true) {\n                            if (velX &gt; 0) {\n                                x += -1;\n                            } else {\n                                x += 1;\n                            }\n                            if (!wallCol()) {break};\n                        }\n                        velX = 0;\n                    }\n                }\n\n                shoot();\n\n                updateBullets();\n\n                updateEnms();\n            }\n            \n            function ground() {\n                if (wallCol()) {\n                    while (true) {\n                        if (velY &gt; 0) {y += -1} else {y += 1};\n                        if (!wallCol()) {\n                            break;\n                        }\n                    }\n                    velY = 0;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function shoot() {\n                if (reload &lt; fireRate) {\n                    reload += 1;\n                }\n\n                if ((KEYS.space || KEYS.down) &amp;&amp; reload == fireRate) {\n                    reload = 0;\n                    bulletsX.push(x);\n                    bulletsY.push(y);\n                    bulletsDir.push(lastMove);\n                }\n            }\n\n            function updateBullets() {\n                for (var i = 0; i &lt; bulletsDir.length; i++) {\n                    if (bulletsDir[i] == &quot;right&quot;) {bulletsX[i] += bulletSpeed} else {bulletsX[i] += -bulletSpeed};\n                    if (wallColBullets(i)) {\n                        bulletsX.splice(i, 1);\n                        bulletsY.splice(i, 1);\n                        bulletsDir.splice(i, 1);\n                        i--;\n                        continue;\n                    }\n                    if (!enmColBullets(i) == false) {\n                        if (!enmsHp[enmColBullets(i)] &lt; 2) {\n                            enmsHp[enmColBullets(i)] += -1;\n                        } else {\n                            enmsX.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                            enmsY.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                            enmsVelX.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                            enmsVelY.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                            enmsMaxVelX.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                            enmsMaxVelY.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                            enmsLastMove.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                            enmsHp.splice(enmColBullets(i));\n                        }\n                        bulletsX.splice(i, 1);\n                        bulletsY.splice(i, 1);\n                        bulletsDir.splice(i, 1);\n                        i--;\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n\n            function updateEnms() {\n                for (j = 0; j &lt; enmsX.length; j++) {\n\n                    if (!wallColEnms() &amp;&amp; (enmsVelY[j] &lt;= enmsMaxVelY[j] - 0.5)) {enmsVelY[j] += 0.5};\n                    groundEnms();\n\n                    enmsY[j] += 1;\n                    if (y+playerHeight &lt; enmsY[j] &amp;&amp; wallColEnms() &amp;&amp; enmsVelY[j] &gt; 0) {\n                        enmsVelY[j] = -15;\n                    }\n                    enmsY[j] += -1;\n\n                    enmsY[j] += Math.round(enmsVelY[j]);\n\n                    if (enmsVelX[j]&gt;0) {\n                        enmsVelX[j] += -0.25;\n                    }\n                \n                    if (enmsVelX[j]&lt;0) {\n                        enmsVelX[j] += 0.25;\n                    }\n                \n                    if (x+1 &gt; enmsX[j]  &amp;&amp; enmsVelX[j]&lt;=enmsMaxVelX[j]) {\n                        enmsVelX[j] += 0.5;\n                    }\n                \n                    if (x+-1 &lt; enmsX[j]  &amp;&amp; enmsVelX[j]&gt;=-enmsMaxVelX[j]) {\n                        enmsVelX[j] += -0.5;\n                    }\n                    if (enmsVelX[j] &gt; enmsMaxVelX[j]) {enmsVelX[j] = enmsMaxVelX[j]};\n                    if (enmsVelX[j] &lt; -enmsMaxVelX[j]) {enmsVelX[j] = -enmsMaxVelX[j]};\n\n                    if (KEYS.left) {\n                        enmsLastMove[j] = &quot;left&quot;;\n                    }\n                    if (KEYS.right) {\n                        enmsLastMove[j] = &quot;right&quot;;\n                    }\n\n                    groundEnms();\n\n                    enmsX[j] += Math.round(enmsVelX[j]);\n                    if (wallColEnms()) {\n                        while (true) {\n                            if (enmsVelX[j] &gt; 0) {\n                                enmsX[j] += -1;\n                            } else {\n                                enmsX[j] += 1;\n                            }\n                            if (!wallColEnms()) {break};\n                        }\n                        enmsVelX[j] = 0;\n                   }\n                }\n            }\n\n            function groundEnms() {\n                if (wallColEnms()) {\n                    while (true) {\n                        if (enmsVelY[j] &gt; 0) {enmsY[j] += -1} else {enmsY[j] += 1};\n                        if (!wallColEnms()) {break};\n                    }\n                    enmsVelY[j] = 0;\n                }\n            }\n\n            function wallColEnms() {\n                for (k = 0; k &lt; platformsX.length; k++) {\n                    if (col(enmsX[j], enmsY[j], playerWidth, playerHeight, platformsX[k], platformsY[k], tileLength, tileLength)) {\n                        return true;\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n                return false;\n            }\n\n            function render() {\n                PANEL.save();\n                setColour(255, 255, 255, 1);\n                PANEL.fillRect(0, 0, CANVAS.width, CANVAS.height);\n                PANEL.restore();\n                PANEL.font = &quot;30px Arial&quot;;\n                \n                setColour(255, 0, 0, 1);\n                rect(x, y, playerWidth, playerHeight, &quot;fill&quot;);\n                \n                \n                setColour(0, 0, 255, 1);\n                for (i = 0; i &lt; platformsX.length; i++) {\n                    rect(platformsX[i], platformsY[i], tileLength, tileLength);\n                }\n                \n                setColour(255, 0, 0, 1);\n                for (i = 0; i &lt; bulletsDir.length; i++) {\n                    rect(bulletsX[i], bulletsY[i], bulletsWidth, bulletsHeight);\n                }\n                \n                setColour(0, 255, 0, 1);\n                for (i = 0; i &lt; enmsX.length; i++) {\n                    rect(enmsX[i], enmsY[i], playerWidth, playerHeight);\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function col(x1, y1, w1, h1, x2, y2, w2, h2) {\n                if ((   ((x1-(w1*0.5))&lt;(x2-(w2*-0.5)))&amp;&amp;((x1+(w1*0.5))&gt;(x2+(w2*-0.5))   ))&amp;&amp;((   ((y1-(h1*0.5))&lt;(y2-(h2*-0.5)))&amp;&amp;((y1+(h1*0.5))&gt;(y2+(h2*-0.5)))   ))) {\n                    return true;\n                } else {\n                    return false;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function wallCol() {\n                for (i = 0; i &lt; platformsX.length; i++) {\n                    if (col(x, y, playerWidth, playerHeight, platformsX[i], platformsY[i], tileLength, tileLength)) {\n                        return true;\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            function wallColBullets(index) {\n                for (i = 0; i &lt; platformsX.length; i++) {\n                    if (col(bulletsX[index], bulletsY[index], bulletsWidth, bulletsHeight, platformsX[i], platformsY[i], tileLength, tileLength)) {\n                        return true;\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n                return false\n            }\n            \n            function enmColBullets(index) {\n                var colliding = false;\n                for (i = 0; i &lt; enmsX.length; i++) {\n                    if (col(bulletsX[index], bulletsY[index], bulletsWidth, bulletsHeight, enmsX[i], enmsY[i], playerWidth, playerHeight)) {\n                        colliding = i;\n                        break;\n                    }\n                }\n                return colliding;\n            }\n            \n            function setColour(r, g, b, a) {\n                PANEL.fillStyle = PANEL.strokeStyle = &quot;rgba(&quot; + r + &quot;,&quot; + g + &quot;,&quot; + b + &quot;,&quot; + a + &quot;)&quot;;\n            }\n            \n            function rect(x, y, w, h, t) {\n                if (t == &quot;stroke&quot;) {\n                    PANEL.strokeRect(x - (w / 2), y - (h / 2), w, h);\n                } else {\n                    PANEL.fillRect(x - (w / 2), y - (h / 2), w, h);\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function circle(x, y, r, t) {\n                PANEL.beginPath();\n                PANEL.arc(x, y, w, h, 1.5708, 0, 2 * math.pi);\n                if (t == &quot;stroke&quot;) {\n                    PANEL.stroke();\n                } else {\n                    PANEL.fill();\n                }\n            }\n            \n            function oval(x, y, w, h, t) {\n                \n                if (t == &quot;stroke&quot;) {\n                    PANEL.stroke();\n                } else {\n                    PANEL.fill();\n                }\n            }```\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":186,"question_id":65039173,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I want to display some data in a table this is my JSX code:</p>\n<pre><code>const StudentsTable = (props) =&gt; {\n  const classes = useStyles();\n  return (\n    &lt;TableContainer component={Paper}&gt;\n      &lt;Table className={classes.table} aria-label=&quot;simple table&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;TableHead&gt;\n          &lt;TableRow&gt;\n            &lt;TableCell&gt;NR.&lt;/TableCell&gt;\n            &lt;TableCell align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;NUME&lt;/TableCell&gt;\n            &lt;TableCell align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;E-MAIL&lt;/TableCell&gt;\n            &lt;TableCell align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;NR.TELEFON&lt;/TableCell&gt;\n            &lt;TableCell align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;CLASA&lt;/TableCell&gt;\n            &lt;TableCell align=&quot;right&quot;&gt;ACTIUNI&lt;/TableCell&gt;\n          &lt;/TableRow&gt;\n        &lt;/TableHead&gt;\n        &lt;TableBody&gt;\n          {props.students.length &gt; 0 ? {"body":"<p>In my Gatsby app user is able to upload an image which is being saved locally and ideally displayed but <code>gatsby-image</code> doesn't see new image this is how my <code>Image.js</code> file looks like.</p>\n<p>I'm thinking that the graphql data needs to be somehow refreshed because the new image doesn't even show if I do <code>console.log(data.images)</code> but how can I do that?</p>\n<pre><code>import React from &quot;react&quot;\nimport { StaticQuery, graphql } from &quot;gatsby&quot;\nimport Img from &quot;gatsby-image&quot;\n\nconst Image = props =&gt; {"body":"<p>I am working on a React web application that has multiple instances of Wavesurfer audio players that can play concurrently. Ideally I would like to be able to play several of them at once, and then click 'Record' on another button to record the mix of sounds. Before attempting this I am writing a smaller app to just record the output from one Wavesurfer instance into a MediaRecorder object, taking my cues from <a href=\"https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/AudioContext/createMediaStreamDestination\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">here</a></p>\n<p>Below is my code for the main component - what I am expecting to happen is the user clicks play on the audio, clicks the record button, then clicks to stop recording and the <code>&lt;audio&gt;</code> element should then house the recorded audio:</p>\n<pre><code>import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';\nimport WaveSurfer from 'wavesurfer.js';\n\nfunction Waveform({ src }) {\n  const [wavesurferPlayer, setWavesurferPlayer] = useState(null);\n  const [isLooping, setIsLooping] = useState(false);\n  const [isPlaying, setIsPlaying] = useState(false);\n  const waveContainerRef = useRef();\n\n  const AudioContext = window.AudioContext || window.webkitAudioContext;\n  const ctx = new AudioContext();\n  let chunks = [];\n  const dest = ctx.createMediaStreamDestination();\n  const mediaRecorder = new MediaRecorder(dest.stream);\n\n  mediaRecorder.ondataavailable = function(evt) {\n    console.log(evt);\n    chunks.push(evt.data);\n  }\n\n  mediaRecorder.onstop = function(evt) {\n    console.log('stopped');\n    let blob = new Blob(chunks, { 'type' : 'audio/ogg; codecs=opus' });\n    console.log(blob);\n    document.getElementById(&quot;blargaudio&quot;).src = URL.createObjectURL(blob);\n  }\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    const wavesurferInstance = WaveSurfer.create({\n      audioContext: ctx,\n      container: waveContainerRef.current,\n      waveColor: &quot;#999&quot;,\n      progressColor: &quot;#00ffaf&quot;,\n      backend: &quot;WebAudio&quot;,\n      responsive: true,\n    });\n\n    wavesurferInstance.load(src);\n\n    wavesurferInstance.fireEvent('ready');\n\n    // const bufferSource = wavesurferInstance.backend.ac.createBufferSource();\n    // bufferSource.buffer = wavesurferInstance.backend.buffer;\n    // bufferSource.connect(wavesurferInstance.backend.ac.destination);\n\n    setWavesurferPlayer(wavesurferInstance);\n  }, []);\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    if (wavesurferPlayer) {\n      if (isLooping) {\n        wavesurferPlayer.on('finish', () =&gt; {\n          wavesurferPlayer.play();\n        });\n      } else {\n        wavesurferPlayer.on('finish', () =&gt; {\n          wavesurferPlayer.pause();\n        });\n      }\n    }\n\n  }, [wavesurferPlayer, isLooping]);\n\n  const handlePlayClick = () =&gt; {\n    if (isPlaying) {\n      setIsPlaying(false);\n      wavesurferPlayer.pause();\n    } else {\n      setIsPlaying(true);\n      wavesurferPlayer.play();\n    }\n  }\n\n  const startRecording = () =&gt; {\n    mediaRecorder.start();\n  }\n\n  const stopRecording = () =&gt; {\n    mediaRecorder.requestData();\n    mediaRecorder.stop();\n  }\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;waveform&quot;&gt;\n      &lt;button onClick={handlePlayClick}&gt;{isPlaying? 'Pause' : 'Play'}&lt;/button&gt;\n      &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; setIsLooping(!isLooping)}&gt;Loop&lt;/button&gt;\n      &lt;p&gt;{isLooping ? 'Looping on' : 'Looping off'}&lt;/p&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;wave&quot; ref={waveContainerRef}&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n      &lt;div&gt;\n        &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; startRecording()}&gt;RECORD&lt;/button&gt;\n        &lt;button onClick={() =&gt; stopRecording()}&gt;STOP&lt;/button&gt;\n        &lt;audio id=&quot;blargaudio&quot; controls&gt;&lt;/audio&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  )\n}\n\nexport default Waveform\n</code></pre>\n<p>At this point I can't seem to figure out how to connect the output of the Wavesurfer instance to the context destination node. {"body":"<p>I'm making a website where I want to have three different user levels. Basic (1), Premium (2) and Admin (3). Based on the user's level I want them to be able to access different parts/pages of the website.</p>\n<p>When the user registers, they're automatically assigned level 1. I want to make it so that when the user logs in, they're redirected to the corresponding page for their level (e.g. User is level 3, so when they log in they're taken to /adminhome, but if the user is level 2, they'd be taken to /premiumhome).</p>\n<p>Furthermore I'd like to add this user-level check to every page so that they don't just type in the url and get access to the page they like if they're not meant to have access to it.</p>\n<p>This is the register/login code I've got in modules/users.js:</p>\n<pre><code>async register(user, pass) {\n    try {\n        if(user.length === 0) throw new Error('missing username')\n        if(pass.length === 0) throw new Error('missing password')\n        let sql = `SELECT COUNT(id) as records FROM users WHERE user=&quot;${user}&quot;;`\n        const data = await this.db.get(sql)\n        if(data.records !== 0) throw new Error(`username &quot;${user}&quot; already in use`)\n        pass = await bcrypt.hash(pass, saltRounds)\n        sql = `INSERT INTO users(user, pass, level) VALUES(&quot;${user}&quot;, &quot;${pass}&quot;, &quot;1&quot;)`\n        await this.db.run(sql)\n        return true\n    } catch(err) {\n        throw err\n    }\n}\n\nasync login(username, password) {\n    try {\n        let sql = `SELECT count(id) AS count FROM users WHERE user=&quot;${username}&quot;;`\n        const records = await this.db.get(sql)\n        if(!records.count) throw new Error(`username &quot;${username}&quot; not found`)\n        sql = `SELECT pass FROM users WHERE user = &quot;${username}&quot;;`\n        const record = await this.db.get(sql)\n        const valid = await bcrypt.compare(password, record.pass)\n        if(valid === false) throw new Error(`invalid password for account &quot;${username}&quot;`)\n        return true\n    } catch(err) {\n        throw err\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>And this is the login code in the index.js file:</p>\n<pre><code>router.post('/login', async ctx =&gt; {\ntry {\n    const body = ctx.request.body\n    const user = await new User(dbName)\n    await user.login(body.user, body.pass)\n    ctx.session.authorised = true\n    return ctx.redirect('/homepage')\n} catch(err) {\n    await ctx.render('error', {message: err.message})\n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":196,"question_id":65038903,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I've got the following in React/JavaScript:</p>\n<pre><code>const uploadImage = (e) =&gt; {\n    e.preventDefault();\n\n    const uploadData = async () =&gt; {\n\n    const token = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('token'));\n\n    try {\n            data = await axios({\n            method: 'post',\n            url: 'http://192.168.1.218:8080/api/image/upload',\n            data: {\n                        data: base64,\n                        name: 'file',\n                        type: 'image/jpeg'\n            },\n            headers: {  &quot;Content-Type&quot;: &quot;multipart/form-data; boundary=&lt;calculated when request is sent&gt;&quot;,\n                        &quot;Authorization&quot;: `Bearer ${token}` \n                    }\n                    \n        })\n        } catch (error) {\n            console.log(error)\n        }\n      }\n      uploadData()\n   }\n</code></pre>\n<p>But when I click on the button I get the following in the console:</p>\n<pre><code>&gt; {"body":"<p>I'm developing a very small image manipulation webapp and it currently is working well.</p>\n<p>There is one issue where if the image loaded into the canvas is very large (larger than the desktop screen resolution), it is desired to zoom out of the page such that manipulating the image in the canvas is more tractable.</p>\n<p>That works fine for the image, but the issue is that the rest of the application is zoomed as well (such as the palette, toolbar, etc.)</p>\n<p>Is it possible to have page zoom only affect the canvas element and none of the other elements?</p>\n<p>Otherwise, is it possible to modify built-in browser page zoom to accomplish this sort of functionality?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":199,"question_id":65038853,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
